web2py Web Framework
Package web2py :: Package gluon :: Module dal
[hide private]
[frames] | no frames]

Source Code for Module web2py.gluon.dal

   1  #!/bin/env python 
   2  # -*- coding: utf-8 -*- 
   3   
   4  """ 
   5  This file is part of the web2py Web Framework 
   6  Copyrighted by Massimo Di Pierro <mdipierro@cs.depaul.edu> 
   7  License: LGPLv3 (http://www.gnu.org/licenses/lgpl.html) 
   8   
   9  Thanks to 
  10      * Niall Sweeny <niall.sweeny@fonjax.com> for MS SQL support 
  11      * Marcel Leuthi <mluethi@mlsystems.ch> for Oracle support 
  12      * Denes 
  13      * Chris Clark 
  14      * clach05 
  15      * Denes Lengyel 
  16      * and many others who have contributed to current and previous versions 
  17   
  18  This file contains the DAL support for many relational databases, 
  19  including: 
  20  - SQLite & SpatiaLite 
  21  - MySQL 
  22  - Postgres 
  23  - Firebird 
  24  - Oracle 
  25  - MS SQL 
  26  - DB2 
  27  - Interbase 
  28  - Ingres 
  29  - SapDB (experimental) 
  30  - Cubrid (experimental) 
  31  - CouchDB (experimental) 
  32  - MongoDB (in progress) 
  33  - Google:nosql 
  34  - Google:sql 
  35  - Teradata 
  36  - IMAP (experimental) 
  37   
  38  Example of usage: 
  39   
  40  >>> # from dal import DAL, Field 
  41   
  42  ### create DAL connection (and create DB if it doesn't exist) 
  43  >>> db = DAL(('sqlite://storage.sqlite','mysql://a:b@localhost/x'),  
  44  ... folder=None) 
  45   
  46  ### define a table 'person' (create/alter as necessary) 
  47  >>> person = db.define_table('person',Field('name','string')) 
  48   
  49  ### insert a record 
  50  >>> id = person.insert(name='James') 
  51   
  52  ### retrieve it by id 
  53  >>> james = person(id) 
  54   
  55  ### retrieve it by name 
  56  >>> james = person(name='James') 
  57   
  58  ### retrieve it by arbitrary query 
  59  >>> query = (person.name=='James') & (person.name.startswith('J')) 
  60  >>> james = db(query).select(person.ALL)[0] 
  61   
  62  ### update one record 
  63  >>> james.update_record(name='Jim') 
  64   
  65  ### update multiple records by query 
  66  >>> db(person.name.like('J%')).update(name='James') 
  67  1 
  68   
  69  ### delete records by query 
  70  >>> db(person.name.lower() == 'jim').delete() 
  71  0 
  72   
  73  ### retrieve multiple records (rows) 
  74  >>> people = db(person).select(orderby=person.name, 
  75  ... groupby=person.name, limitby=(0,100)) 
  76   
  77  ### further filter them 
  78  >>> james = people.find(lambda row: row.name == 'James').first() 
  79  >>> print james.id, james.name 
  80  1 James 
  81   
  82  ### check aggregates 
  83  >>> counter = person.id.count() 
  84  >>> print db(person).select(counter).first()(counter) 
  85  1 
  86   
  87  ### delete one record 
  88  >>> james.delete_record() 
  89  1 
  90   
  91  ### delete (drop) entire database table 
  92  >>> person.drop() 
  93   
  94  Supported field types: 
  95  id string text boolean integer double decimal password upload 
  96  blob time date datetime 
  97   
  98  Supported DAL URI strings: 
  99  'sqlite://test.db' 
 100  'spatialite://test.db' 
 101  'sqlite:memory' 
 102  'spatialite:memory' 
 103  'jdbc:sqlite://test.db' 
 104  'mysql://root:none@localhost/test' 
 105  'postgres://mdipierro:password@localhost/test' 
 106  'postgres:psycopg2://mdipierro:password@localhost/test' 
 107  'postgres:pg8000://mdipierro:password@localhost/test' 
 108  'jdbc:postgres://mdipierro:none@localhost/test' 
 109  'mssql://web2py:none@A64X2/web2py_test' 
 110  'mssql2://web2py:none@A64X2/web2py_test' # alternate mappings 
 111  'oracle://username:password@database' 
 112  'firebird://user:password@server:3050/database' 
 113  'db2://DSN=dsn;UID=user;PWD=pass' 
 114  'firebird://username:password@hostname/database' 
 115  'firebird_embedded://username:password@c://path' 
 116  'informix://user:password@server:3050/database' 
 117  'informixu://user:password@server:3050/database' # unicode informix 
 118  'google:datastore' # for google app engine datastore 
 119  'google:sql' # for google app engine with sql (mysql compatible) 
 120  'teradata://DSN=dsn;UID=user;PWD=pass; DATABASE=database' # experimental 
 121  'imap://user:password@server:port' # experimental 
 122   
 123  For more info: 
 124  help(DAL) 
 125  help(Field) 
 126  """ 
 127   
 128  ################################################################################### 
 129  # this file only exposes DAL and Field 
 130  ################################################################################### 
 131   
 132  __all__ = ['DAL', 'Field'] 
 133   
 134  MAXCHARLENGTH = 2**15 # not quite but reasonable default max char length 
 135  DEFAULTLENGTH = {'string':512, 
 136                   'password':512, 
 137                   'upload':512, 
 138                   'text':2**15, 
 139                   'blob':2**31} 
 140  TIMINGSSIZE = 100 
 141  SPATIALLIBS = { 
 142      'Windows':'libspatialite', 
 143      'Linux':'libspatialite.so', 
 144      'Darwin':'libspatialite.dylib' 
 145      } 
 146

 177                   types.MethodType, types.BuiltinMethodType)

 182       'common_filter','polymodel','table_class','on_define'))

 185      ('orderby', 'groupby', 'limitby','required', 'cache', 'left', 
 186       'distinct', 'having', 'join','for_update', 'processor','cacheable'))

 189  ogetattr = object.__getattribute__ 
 190  osetattr = object.__setattr__ 
 191  exists = os.path.exists 
 192  pjoin = os.path.join

 204  try: 
 205      import portalocker 
 206      have_portalocker = True 
 207  except ImportError: 
 208      have_portalocker = False 
 209   
 210  try: 
 211      import serializers 
 212      have_serializers = True 
 213  except ImportError: 
 214      have_serializers = False

 217      import validators 
 218      have_validators = True

 220      have_validators = False

 222  logger = logging.getLogger("web2py.dal") 
 223  DEFAULT = lambda:0 
 224   
 225  sql_locker = threading.RLock() 
 226  thread = threading.local() 
 227   
 228  # internal representation of tables with field 
 229  #  <table>.<field>, tables and fields may only be [a-zA-Z0-9_] 
 230   
 231  REGEX_TYPE = re.compile('^([\w\_\:]+)') 
 232  REGEX_DBNAME = re.compile('^(\w+)(\:\w+)*') 
 233  REGEX_W = re.compile('^\w+$') 
 234  REGEX_TABLE_DOT_FIELD = re.compile('^(\w+)\.(\w+)$') 
 235  REGEX_UPLOAD_PATTERN = re.compile('(?P<table>[\w\-]+)\.(?P<field>[\w\-]+)\.(?P<uuidkey>[\w\-]+)\.(?P<name>\w+)\.\w+$') 
 236  REGEX_CLEANUP_FN = re.compile('[\'"\s;]+') 
 237  REGEX_UNPACK = re.compile('(?<!\|)\|(?!\|)') 
 238  REGEX_PYTHON_KEYWORDS = re.compile('^(and|del|from|not|while|as|elif|global|or|with|assert|else|if|pass|yield|break|except|import|print|class|exec|in|raise|continue|finally|is|return|def|for|lambda|try)$') 
 239  REGEX_SELECT_AS_PARSER = re.compile("\s+AS\s+(\S+)") 
 240  REGEX_CONST_STRING = re.compile('(\"[^\"]*?\")|(\'[^\']*?\')') 
 241  REGEX_SEARCH_PATTERN = re.compile('^{[^\.]+\.[^\.]+(\.(lt|gt|le|ge|eq|ne|contains|startswith|year|month|day|hour|minute|second))?(\.not)?}$') 
 242  REGEX_SQUARE_BRACKETS = re.compile('^.+\[.+\]$') 
 243  REGEX_STORE_PATTERN = re.compile('\.(?P<e>\w{1,5})$') 
 244  REGEX_QUOTES = re.compile("'[^']*'") 
 245  REGEX_ALPHANUMERIC = re.compile('^[a-zA-Z]\w*$') 
 246   
 247  # list of drivers will be built on the fly 
 248  # and lists only what is available 
 249  DRIVERS = [] 
 250   
 251  try: 
 252      from new import classobj 
 253      from google.appengine.ext import db as gae 
 254      from google.appengine.api import namespace_manager, rdbms 
 255      from google.appengine.api.datastore_types import Key  ### for belongs on ID 
 256      from google.appengine.ext.db.polymodel import PolyModel 
 257      DRIVERS.append('google') 
 258  except ImportError: 
 259      pass 
 260   
 261  if not 'google' in DRIVERS: 
 262   
 263      try: 
 264          from pysqlite2 import dbapi2 as sqlite2 
 265          DRIVERS.append('SQLite(sqlite2)') 
 266      except ImportError: 
 267          logger.debug('no SQLite drivers pysqlite2.dbapi2') 
 268   
 269      try: 
 270          from sqlite3 import dbapi2 as sqlite3 
 271          DRIVERS.append('SQLite(sqlite3)') 
 272      except ImportError: 
 273          logger.debug('no SQLite drivers sqlite3') 
 274   
 275      try: 
 276          # first try contrib driver, then from site-packages (if installed) 
 277          try: 
 278              import contrib.pymysql as pymysql 
 279              # monkeypatch pymysql because they havent fixed the bug: 
 280              # https://github.com/petehunt/PyMySQL/issues/86 
 281              pymysql.ESCAPE_REGEX = re.compile("'") 
 282              pymysql.ESCAPE_MAP = {"'": "''"} 
 283              # end monkeypatch 
 284          except ImportError: 
 285              import pymysql 
 286          DRIVERS.append('MySQL(pymysql)') 
 287      except ImportError: 
 288          logger.debug('no MySQL driver pymysql') 
 289   
 290      try: 
 291          import MySQLdb 
 292          DRIVERS.append('MySQL(MySQLdb)') 
 293      except ImportError: 
 294          logger.debug('no MySQL driver MySQLDB') 
 295   
 296   
 297      try: 
 298          import psycopg2 
 299          from psycopg2.extensions import adapt as psycopg2_adapt 
 300          DRIVERS.append('PostgreSQL(psycopg2)') 
 301      except ImportError: 
 302          logger.debug('no PostgreSQL driver psycopg2') 
 303   
 304      try: 
 305          # first try contrib driver, then from site-packages (if installed) 
 306          try: 
 307              import contrib.pg8000.dbapi as pg8000 
 308          except ImportError: 
 309              import pg8000.dbapi as pg8000 
 310          DRIVERS.append('PostgreSQL(pg8000)') 
 311      except ImportError: 
 312          logger.debug('no PostgreSQL driver pg8000') 
 313   
 314      try: 
 315          import cx_Oracle 
 316          DRIVERS.append('Oracle(cx_Oracle)') 
 317      except ImportError: 
 318          logger.debug('no Oracle driver cx_Oracle') 
 319   
 320      try: 
 321          import pyodbc 
 322          DRIVERS.append('MSSQL(pyodbc)') 
 323          DRIVERS.append('DB2(pyodbc)') 
 324          DRIVERS.append('Teradata(pyodbc)') 
 325      except ImportError: 
 326          logger.debug('no MSSQL/DB2/Teradata driver pyodbc') 
 327   
 328      try: 
 329          import Sybase 
 330          DRIVERS.append('Sybase(Sybase)') 
 331      except ImportError: 
 332          logger.debug('no Sybase driver') 
 333

 335          import kinterbasdb 
 336          DRIVERS.append('Interbase(kinterbasdb)') 
 337          DRIVERS.append('Firebird(kinterbasdb)') 
 338      except ImportError: 
 339          logger.debug('no Firebird/Interbase driver kinterbasdb')

 344      except ImportError:

 357      except ImportError:

 364      except ImportError:

 370          logger.warning('Cubrid support is experimental') 
 371      except ImportError:

 373   
 374      try: 
 375          from com.ziclix.python.sql import zxJDBC 
 376          import java.sql 
 377          # Try sqlite jdbc driver from http://www.zentus.com/sqlitejdbc/ 
 378          from org.sqlite import JDBC # required by java.sql; ensure we have it 
 379          zxJDBC_sqlite = java.sql.DriverManager 
 380          DRIVERS.append('PostgreSQL(zxJDBC)') 
 381          DRIVERS.append('SQLite(zxJDBC)') 
 382          logger.warning('zxJDBC support is experimental') 
 383          is_jdbc = True 
 384      except ImportError: 
 385          logger.debug('no SQLite/PostgreSQL driver zxJDBC') 
 386          is_jdbc = False

 388      try: 
 389          import ingresdbi

 391      except ImportError: 
 392          logger.debug('no Ingres driver ingresdbi') 
 393      # NOTE could try JDBC.......

 398      except ImportError: 
 399          logger.debug('no Couchdb driver couchdb')

 411          logger.debug('no IMAP driver imaplib')

 413  PLURALIZE_RULES = [ 
 414      (re.compile('child$'), re.compile('child$'), 'children'), 
 415      (re.compile('oot$'), re.compile('oot$'), 'eet'), 
 416      (re.compile('ooth$'), re.compile('ooth$'), 'eeth'), 
 417      (re.compile('l[eo]af$'), re.compile('l([eo])af$'), 'l\\1aves'), 
 418      (re.compile('sis$'), re.compile('sis$'), 'ses'), 
 419      (re.compile('man$'), re.compile('man$'), 'men'), 
 420      (re.compile('ife$'), re.compile('ife$'), 'ives'), 
 421      (re.compile('eau$'), re.compile('eau$'), 'eaux'), 
 422      (re.compile('lf$'), re.compile('lf$'), 'lves'), 
 423      (re.compile('[sxz]$'), re.compile('$'), 'es'), 
 424      (re.compile('[^aeioudgkprt]h$'), re.compile('$'), 'es'), 
 425      (re.compile('(qu|[^aeiou])y$'), re.compile('y$'), 'ies'), 
 426      (re.compile('$'), re.compile('$'), 's'), 
 427      ] 
 428   

 429 -def pluralize(singular, rules=PLURALIZE_RULES): 

 430      for line in rules: 
 431          re_search, re_sub, replace = line 
 432          plural = re_search.search(singular) and re_sub.sub(replace, singular) 
 433          if plural: return plural 

 434   

 435 -def OR(a,b): 

 436      return a|b 

 437   

 438 -def AND(a,b): 

 439      return a&b 

 440   

 441 -def IDENTITY(x): return x 

 442   

 443 -def varquote_aux(name,quotestr='%s'): 

 444      return name if REGEX_W.match(name) else quotestr % name

 450 -    class GAEDecimalProperty(gae.Property): 

 451          """ 
 452          GAE decimal implementation 
 453          """ 
 454          data_type = decimal.Decimal 
 455   

 456 -        def __init__(self, precision, scale, **kwargs): 

 457              super(GAEDecimalProperty, self).__init__(self, **kwargs) 
 458              d = '1.' 
 459              for x in range(scale): 
 460                  d += '0' 
 461              self.round = decimal.Decimal(d) 

 462   

 463 -        def get_value_for_datastore(self, model_instance): 

 464              value = super(GAEDecimalProperty, self)\ 
 465                  .get_value_for_datastore(model_instance) 
 466              if value is None or value == '': 
 467                  return None 
 468              else: 
 469                  return str(value) 

 470   

 471 -        def make_value_from_datastore(self, value): 

 472              if value is None or value == '': 
 473                  return None 
 474              else: 
 475                  return decimal.Decimal(value).quantize(self.round) 

 476   

 477 -        def validate(self, value): 

 478              value = super(GAEDecimalProperty, self).validate(value) 
 479              if value is None or isinstance(value, decimal.Decimal): 
 480                  return value 
 481              elif isinstance(value, basestring): 
 482                  return decimal.Decimal(value) 
 483              raise gae.BadValueError("Property %s must be a Decimal or string."\ 
 484                                          % self.name)

 486  ################################################################################### 
 487  # class that handles connection pooling (all adapters are derived from this one) 
 488  ################################################################################### 
 489   

 490 -class ConnectionPool(object): 

 491   
 492      pools = {} 
 493      check_active_connection = True 
 494   
 495      @staticmethod 

 496 -    def set_folder(folder): 

 497          thread.folder = folder 

 498   
 499      # ## this allows gluon to commit/rollback all dbs in this thread 
 500   
 501      @staticmethod 

 502 -    def close_all_instances(action): 

 503          """ to close cleanly databases in a multithreaded environment """ 
 504          if hasattr(thread, 'instances'): 
 505              while thread.instances: 
 506                  instance = thread.instances.pop() 
 507                  if action: 
 508                      if callable(action): 
 509                          action(instance) 
 510                      else: 
 511                          getattr(instance, action)() 
 512                  # ## if you want pools, recycle this connection 
 513                  really = True 
 514                  if instance.pool_size: 
 515                      sql_locker.acquire() 
 516                      pool = ConnectionPool.pools[instance.uri] 
 517                      if len(pool) < instance.pool_size: 
 518                          pool.append(instance.connection) 
 519                          really = False 
 520                      sql_locker.release() 
 521                  if really: 
 522                      getattr(instance, 'close')() 
 523   
 524          if callable(action): 
 525              action(None) 
 526          return 

 527   

 528 -    def find_or_make_work_folder(self): 

 529          """ this actually does not make the folder. it has to be there """ 
 530          if hasattr(thread,'folder'): 
 531              self.folder = thread.folder 
 532          else: 
 533              self.folder = thread.folder = '' 
 534   
 535          # Creating the folder if it does not exist 
 536          if False and self.folder and not exists(self.folder): 
 537              os.mkdir(self.folder) 

 538   

 539 -    def after_connection(self): 

 540          """ this it is suppoed to be overloaded by adtapters""" 
 541          pass 

 542   

 543 -    def reconnect(self): 

 544          """ allows a thread to re-connect to server or re-pool """ 
 545          self.close_all_instances(False) 
 546          self.pool_connection(self._connection_function) 
 547          self.after_connection() 

 548   

 549 -    def pool_connection(self, f, cursor=True): 

 550          """ 
 551          this function defines: self.connection and self.cursor 
 552          (iff cursor is True) 
 553          if self.pool_size>0 it will try pull the connection from the pool 
 554          if the connection is not active (closed by db server) it will loop 
 555          if not self.pool_size or no active connections in pool makes a new one 
 556          """ 
 557          pools = ConnectionPool.pools 
 558          self._connection_function = f 
 559          if not self.pool_size: 
 560              self.connection = f() 
 561              self.cursor = cursor and self.connection.cursor() 
 562          else: 
 563              uri = self.uri 
 564              while True: 
 565                  sql_locker.acquire() 
 566                  if not uri in pools: 
 567                      pools[uri] = [] 
 568                  if pools[uri]: 
 569                      self.connection = pools[uri].pop() 
 570                      sql_locker.release() 
 571                      self.cursor = cursor and self.connection.cursor() 
 572                      try: 
 573                          if self.cursor and self.check_active_connection: 
 574                              self.execute('SELECT 1;') 
 575                          break 
 576                      except: 
 577                          pass 
 578                  else: 
 579                      sql_locker.release() 
 580                      self.connection = f() 
 581                      self.cursor = cursor and self.connection.cursor() 
 582                      break 
 583          if not hasattr(thread,'instances'): 
 584              thread.instances = [] 
 585          thread.instances.append(self) 

 586   
 587   
 588  ################################################################################### 
 589  # this is a generic adapter that does nothing; all others are derived from this one 
 590  ################################################################################### 
 591   

 592 -class BaseAdapter(ConnectionPool): 

 593      driver = None 
 594      driver_name = None 
 595      drivers = () # list of drivers from which to pick 
 596      maxcharlength = MAXCHARLENGTH 
 597      commit_on_alter_table = False 
 598      support_distributed_transaction = False 
 599      uploads_in_blob = False 
 600      can_select_for_update = True 
 601      types = { 
 602          'boolean': 'CHAR(1)', 
 603          'string': 'CHAR(%(length)s)', 
 604          'text': 'TEXT', 
 605          'password': 'CHAR(%(length)s)', 
 606          'blob': 'BLOB', 
 607          'upload': 'CHAR(%(length)s)', 
 608          'integer': 'INTEGER', 
 609          'bigint': 'INTEGER', 
 610          'float':'DOUBLE', 
 611          'double': 'DOUBLE', 
 612          'decimal': 'DOUBLE', 
 613          'date': 'DATE', 
 614          'time': 'TIME', 
 615          'datetime': 'TIMESTAMP', 
 616          'id': 'INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT', 
 617          'reference': 'INTEGER REFERENCES %(foreign_key)s ON DELETE %(on_delete_action)s', 
 618          'list:integer': 'TEXT', 
 619          'list:string': 'TEXT', 
 620          'list:reference': 'TEXT', 
 621          # the two below are only used when DAL(...bigint_id=True) and replace 'id','reference' 
 622          'big-id': 'BIGINT PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT', 
 623          'big-reference': 'BIGINT REFERENCES %(foreign_key)s ON DELETE %(on_delete_action)s', 
 624          } 
 625   

 626 -    def adapt(self, obj): 

 627          return "'%s'" % obj.replace("'", "''") 

 628   

 629 -    def integrity_error(self): 

 630          return self.driver.IntegrityError 

 631   

 632 -    def operational_error(self): 

 633          return self.driver.OperationalError 

 634   

 635 -    def file_exists(self, filename): 

 636          """ 
 637          to be used ONLY for files that on GAE may not be on filesystem 
 638          """ 
 639          return exists(filename) 

 640   

 641 -    def file_open(self, filename, mode='rb', lock=True): 

 642          """ 
 643          to be used ONLY for files that on GAE may not be on filesystem 
 644          """ 
 645          if have_portalocker and lock: 
 646              fileobj = portalocker.LockedFile(filename,mode) 
 647          else: 
 648              fileobj = open(filename,mode) 
 649          return fileobj 

 650   

 651 -    def file_close(self, fileobj): 

 652          """ 
 653          to be used ONLY for files that on GAE may not be on filesystem 
 654          """ 
 655          if fileobj: 
 656              fileobj.close() 

 657   

 658 -    def file_delete(self, filename): 

 659          os.unlink(filename) 

 660   

 661 -    def find_driver(self,adapter_args,uri=None): 

 662          if hasattr(self,'driver') and self.driver!=None: 
 663              return  
 664          drivers_available = [driver for driver in self.drivers 
 665                               if driver in globals()] 
 666          if uri: 
 667              items = uri.split('://',1)[0].split(':') 
 668              request_driver = items[1] if len(items)>1 else None 
 669          else: 
 670              request_driver = None 
 671          request_driver = request_driver or adapter_args.get('driver')             
 672          if request_driver: 
 673              if request_driver in drivers_available: 
 674                  self.driver_name = request_driver 
 675                  self.driver = globals().get(request_driver) 
 676              else: 
 677                  raise RuntimeError, "driver %s not available" % request_driver 
 678          elif drivers_available: 
 679              self.driver_name = drivers_available[0] 
 680              self.driver = globals().get(self.driver_name) 
 681          else: 
 682              raise RuntimeError, "no driver available %s", self.drivers 

 683

 697                  return lambda *a, **b: []

 710 -    def create_table(self, table, 
 711                       migrate=True, 
 712                       fake_migrate=False, 
 713                       polymodel=None): 

 714          db = table._db 
 715          fields = [] 
 716          # PostGIS geo fields are added after the table has been created 
 717          postcreation_fields = [] 
 718          sql_fields = {} 
 719          sql_fields_aux = {} 
 720          TFK = {} 
 721          tablename = table._tablename 
 722          sortable = 0 
 723          types = self.types 
 724          for field in table: 
 725              sortable += 1 
 726              field_name = field.name 
 727              field_type = field.type 
 728              if isinstance(field_type,SQLCustomType): 
 729                  ftype = field_type.native or field_type.type 
 730              elif field_type.startswith('reference'): 
 731                  referenced = field_type[10:].strip() 
 732                  if referenced == '.': 
 733                      referenced = tablename 
 734                  constraint_name = self.constraint_name(tablename, field_name) 
 735                  if not '.' in referenced \ 
 736                          and referenced != tablename \ 
 737                          and hasattr(table,'_primarykey'): 
 738                      ftype = types['integer'] 
 739                  else: 
 740                      if hasattr(table,'_primarykey'): 
 741                          rtablename,rfieldname = referenced.split('.') 
 742                          rtable = db[rtablename] 
 743                          rfield = rtable[rfieldname] 
 744                          # must be PK reference or unique 
 745                          if rfieldname in hasattr(rtable,'_primarykey') or \ 
 746                                  rfield.unique: 
 747                              ftype = types[rfield.type[:9]] % \ 
 748                                  dict(length=rfield.length) 
 749                              # multicolumn primary key reference? 
 750                              if not rfield.unique and len(rtable._primarykey)>1: 
 751                                  # then it has to be a table level FK 
 752                                  if rtablename not in TFK: 
 753                                      TFK[rtablename] = {} 
 754                                  TFK[rtablename][rfieldname] = field_name 
 755                              else: 
 756                                  ftype = ftype + \ 
 757                                      types['reference FK'] % dict( 
 758                                      constraint_name = constraint_name, # should be quoted 
 759                                      foreign_key = '%s (%s)' % (rtablename, 
 760                                                                 rfieldname), 
 761                                      on_delete_action=field.ondelete) 
 762                      else: 
 763                          # make a guess here for circular references 
 764                          if referenced in db: 
 765                              id_fieldname = db[referenced]._id.name 
 766                          elif referenced == tablename: 
 767                              id_fieldname = table._id.name 
 768                          else: #make a guess 
 769                              id_fieldname = 'id' 
 770                          ftype = types[field_type[:9]] % dict( 
 771                              index_name = field_name+'__idx', 
 772                              field_name = field_name, 
 773                              constraint_name = constraint_name, 
 774                              foreign_key = '%s (%s)' % (referenced, 
 775                                                         id_fieldname), 
 776                              on_delete_action=field.ondelete) 
 777              elif field_type.startswith('list:reference'): 
 778                  ftype = types[field_type[:14]] 
 779              elif field_type.startswith('decimal'): 
 780                  precision, scale = map(int,field_type[8:-1].split(',')) 
 781                  ftype = types[field_type[:7]] % \ 
 782                      dict(precision=precision,scale=scale) 
 783              elif field_type.startswith('geo'): 
 784                  srid = self.srid 
 785                  geotype, parms = field_type[:-1].split('(') 
 786                  if not geotype in types: 
 787                      raise SyntaxError, \ 
 788                          'Field: unknown field type: %s for %s' \ 
 789                          % (field_type, field_name) 
 790                  ftype = types[geotype] 
 791                  if self.dbengine == 'postgres' and geotype == 'geometry': 
 792                      # parameters: schema, srid, dimension 
 793                      dimension = 2 # GIS.dimension ??? 
 794                      parms = parms.split(',') 
 795                      if len(parms) == 3: 
 796                          schema, srid, dimension = parms 
 797                      elif len(parms) == 2: 
 798                          schema, srid = parms 
 799                      else: 
 800                          schema = parms[0] 
 801                      ftype = "SELECT AddGeometryColumn ('%%(schema)s', '%%(tablename)s', '%%(fieldname)s', %%(srid)s, '%s', %%(dimension)s);" % types[geotype] 
 802                      ftype = ftype % dict(schema=schema,  
 803                                           tablename=tablename, 
 804                                           fieldname=field_name, srid=srid, 
 805                                           dimension=dimension) 
 806                      postcreation_fields.append(ftype) 
 807              elif not field_type in types: 
 808                  raise SyntaxError, 'Field: unknown field type: %s for %s' % \ 
 809                      (field_type, field_name) 
 810              else: 
 811                  ftype = types[field_type]\ 
 812                       % dict(length=field.length) 
 813              if not field_type.startswith('id') and \ 
 814                      not field_type.startswith('reference'): 
 815                  if field.notnull: 
 816                      ftype += ' NOT NULL' 
 817                  else: 
 818                      ftype += self.ALLOW_NULL() 
 819                  if field.unique: 
 820                      ftype += ' UNIQUE' 
 821                  if field.custom_qualifier: 
 822                      ftype += ' %s' % field.custom_qualifier 
 823   
 824              # add to list of fields 
 825              sql_fields[field_name] = dict( 
 826                  sortable=sortable, 
 827                  type=str(field_type), 
 828                  sql=ftype) 
 829   
 830              if isinstance(field.default,(str,int,float)): 
 831                  # Caveat: sql_fields and sql_fields_aux 
 832                  # differ for default values. 
 833                  # sql_fields is used to trigger migrations and sql_fields_aux 
 834                  # is used for create tables. 
 835                  # The reason is that we do not want to trigger 
 836                  # a migration simply because a default value changes. 
 837                  not_null = self.NOT_NULL(field.default, field_type) 
 838                  ftype = ftype.replace('NOT NULL', not_null) 
 839              sql_fields_aux[field_name] = dict(sql=ftype) 
 840              # Postgres - PostGIS: 
 841              # geometry fields are added after the table has been created, not now 
 842              if not (self.dbengine == 'postgres' and \ 
 843                          field_type.startswith('geom')): 
 844                  fields.append('%s %s' % (field_name, ftype)) 
 845          other = ';' 
 846   
 847          # backend-specific extensions to fields 
 848          if self.dbengine == 'mysql': 
 849              if not hasattr(table, "_primarykey"): 
 850                  fields.append('PRIMARY KEY(%s)' % table._id.name) 
 851              other = ' ENGINE=InnoDB CHARACTER SET utf8;' 
 852   
 853          fields = ',\n    '.join(fields) 
 854          for rtablename in TFK: 
 855              rfields = TFK[rtablename] 
 856              pkeys = db[rtablename]._primarykey 
 857              fkeys = [ rfields[k] for k in pkeys ] 
 858              fields = fields + ',\n    ' + \ 
 859                  types['reference TFK'] % dict( 
 860                  table_name = tablename, 
 861                  field_name=', '.join(fkeys), 
 862                  foreign_table = rtablename, 
 863                  foreign_key = ', '.join(pkeys), 
 864                  on_delete_action = field.ondelete) 
 865   
 866          if hasattr(table,'_primarykey'): 
 867              query = "CREATE TABLE %s(\n    %s,\n    %s) %s" % \ 
 868                  (tablename, fields, 
 869                   self.PRIMARY_KEY(', '.join(table._primarykey)),other) 
 870          else: 
 871              query = "CREATE TABLE %s(\n    %s\n)%s" % \ 
 872                  (tablename, fields, other) 
 873   
 874          if self.uri.startswith('sqlite:///') \ 
 875                  or self.uri.startswith('spatialite:///'): 
 876              path_encoding = sys.getfilesystemencoding() \ 
 877                  or locale.getdefaultlocale()[1] or 'utf8' 
 878              dbpath = self.uri[9:self.uri.rfind('/')]\ 
 879                  .decode('utf8').encode(path_encoding) 
 880          else: 
 881              dbpath = self.folder 
 882   
 883          if not migrate: 
 884              return query 
 885          elif self.uri.startswith('sqlite:memory')\ 
 886                  or self.uri.startswith('spatialite:memory'): 
 887              table._dbt = None 
 888          elif isinstance(migrate, str): 
 889              table._dbt = pjoin(dbpath, migrate) 
 890          else: 
 891              table._dbt = pjoin( 
 892                  dbpath, '%s_%s.table' % (table._db._uri_hash, tablename)) 
 893                       
 894          if table._dbt: 
 895              table._loggername = pjoin(dbpath, 'sql.log') 
 896              logfile = self.file_open(table._loggername, 'a') 
 897          else: 
 898              logfile = None 
 899          if not table._dbt or not self.file_exists(table._dbt): 
 900              if table._dbt: 
 901                  logfile.write('timestamp: %s\n' 
 902                                 % datetime.datetime.today().isoformat()) 
 903                  logfile.write(query + '\n') 
 904              if not fake_migrate: 
 905                  self.create_sequence_and_triggers(query,table) 
 906                  table._db.commit() 
 907                  # Postgres geom fields are added now, 
 908                  # after the table has been created 
 909                  for query in postcreation_fields: 
 910                      self.execute(query) 
 911                      table._db.commit() 
 912              if table._dbt: 
 913                  tfile = self.file_open(table._dbt, 'w') 
 914                  cPickle.dump(sql_fields, tfile) 
 915                  self.file_close(tfile) 
 916                  if fake_migrate: 
 917                      logfile.write('faked!\n') 
 918                  else: 
 919                      logfile.write('success!\n') 
 920          else: 
 921              tfile = self.file_open(table._dbt, 'r') 
 922              try: 
 923                  sql_fields_old = cPickle.load(tfile) 
 924              except EOFError: 
 925                  self.file_close(tfile) 
 926                  self.file_close(logfile) 
 927                  raise RuntimeError, 'File %s appears corrupted' % table._dbt 
 928              self.file_close(tfile) 
 929              if sql_fields != sql_fields_old: 
 930                  self.migrate_table(table, 
 931                                     sql_fields, sql_fields_old, 
 932                                     sql_fields_aux, logfile, 
 933                                     fake_migrate=fake_migrate) 
 934          self.file_close(logfile) 
 935          return query

 937 -    def migrate_table( 
 938          self, 
 939          table, 
 940          sql_fields, 
 941          sql_fields_old, 
 942          sql_fields_aux, 
 943          logfile, 
 944          fake_migrate=False, 
 945          ): 

 946          db = table._db 
 947          db._migrated.append(table._tablename) 
 948          tablename = table._tablename 
 949          def fix(item): 
 950              k,v=item 
 951              if not isinstance(v,dict): 
 952                  v=dict(type='unkown',sql=v) 
 953              return k.lower(),v 

 954          # make sure all field names are lower case to avoid 
 955          # migrations because of case cahnge 
 956          sql_fields = dict(map(fix,sql_fields.iteritems())) 
 957          sql_fields_old = dict(map(fix,sql_fields_old.iteritems())) 
 958          sql_fields_aux = dict(map(fix,sql_fields_aux.iteritems())) 
 959          if db._debug: 
 960              logging.debug('migrating %s to %s' % (sql_fields_old,sql_fields)) 
 961   
 962          keys = sql_fields.keys() 
 963          for key in sql_fields_old: 
 964              if not key in keys: 
 965                  keys.append(key) 
 966          if self.dbengine == 'mssql': 
 967              new_add = '; ALTER TABLE %s ADD ' % tablename 
 968          else: 
 969              new_add = ', ADD ' 
 970   
 971          metadata_change = False 
 972          sql_fields_current = copy.copy(sql_fields_old) 
 973          for key in keys: 
 974              query = None 
 975              if not key in sql_fields_old: 
 976                  sql_fields_current[key] = sql_fields[key] 
 977                  if self.dbengine in ('postgres',) and \ 
 978                     sql_fields[key]['type'].startswith('geometry'): 
 979                      # 'sql' == ftype in sql 
 980                      query = [ sql_fields[key]['sql'] ] 
 981                  else: 
 982                      query = ['ALTER TABLE %s ADD %s %s;' % \ 
 983                           (tablename, key, 
 984                            sql_fields_aux[key]['sql'].replace(', ', new_add))] 
 985                  metadata_change = True 
 986              elif self.dbengine in ('sqlite', 'spatialite'): 
 987                  if key in sql_fields: 
 988                      sql_fields_current[key] = sql_fields[key] 
 989                  metadata_change = True 
 990              elif not key in sql_fields: 
 991                  del sql_fields_current[key] 
 992                  ftype = sql_fields_old[key]['type'] 
 993                  if self.dbengine in ('postgres',) \ 
 994                          and ftype.startswith('geometry'): 
 995                      geotype, parms = ftype[:-1].split('(') 
 996                      schema = parms.split(',')[0] 
 997                      query = [ "SELECT DropGeometryColumn ('%(schema)s', '%(table)s', '%(field)s');" % dict(schema=schema, table=tablename, field=key,) ] 
 998                  elif not self.dbengine in ('firebird',): 
 999                      query = ['ALTER TABLE %s DROP COLUMN %s;' 
1000                               % (tablename, key)] 
1001                  else: 
1002                      query = ['ALTER TABLE %s DROP %s;' % (tablename, key)] 
1003                  metadata_change = True 
1004              elif sql_fields[key]['sql'] != sql_fields_old[key]['sql'] \ 
1005                    and not (key in table.fields and  
1006                             isinstance(table[key].type, SQLCustomType)) \ 
1007                    and not sql_fields[key]['type'].startswith('reference')\ 
1008                    and not sql_fields[key]['type'].startswith('double')\ 
1009                    and not sql_fields[key]['type'].startswith('id'): 
1010                  sql_fields_current[key] = sql_fields[key] 
1011                  t = tablename 
1012                  tt = sql_fields_aux[key]['sql'].replace(', ', new_add) 
1013                  if not self.dbengine in ('firebird',): 
1014                      query = ['ALTER TABLE %s ADD %s__tmp %s;' % (t, key, tt), 
1015                               'UPDATE %s SET %s__tmp=%s;' % (t, key, key), 
1016                               'ALTER TABLE %s DROP COLUMN %s;' % (t, key), 
1017                               'ALTER TABLE %s ADD %s %s;' % (t, key, tt), 
1018                               'UPDATE %s SET %s=%s__tmp;' % (t, key, key), 
1019                               'ALTER TABLE %s DROP COLUMN %s__tmp;' % (t, key)] 
1020                  else: 
1021                      query = ['ALTER TABLE %s ADD %s__tmp %s;' % (t, key, tt), 
1022                               'UPDATE %s SET %s__tmp=%s;' % (t, key, key), 
1023                               'ALTER TABLE %s DROP %s;' % (t, key), 
1024                               'ALTER TABLE %s ADD %s %s;' % (t, key, tt), 
1025                               'UPDATE %s SET %s=%s__tmp;' % (t, key, key), 
1026                               'ALTER TABLE %s DROP %s__tmp;' % (t, key)] 
1027                  metadata_change = True 
1028              elif sql_fields[key]['type'] != sql_fields_old[key]['type']: 
1029                  sql_fields_current[key] = sql_fields[key] 
1030                  metadata_change = True 
1031   
1032              if query: 
1033                  logfile.write('timestamp: %s\n' 
1034                                % datetime.datetime.today().isoformat()) 
1035                  db['_lastsql'] = '\n'.join(query) 
1036                  for sub_query in query: 
1037                      logfile.write(sub_query + '\n') 
1038                      if not fake_migrate: 
1039                          self.execute(sub_query) 
1040                          # Caveat: mysql, oracle and firebird do not allow multiple alter table 
1041                          # in one transaction so we must commit partial transactions and 
1042                          # update table._dbt after alter table. 
1043                          if db._adapter.commit_on_alter_table: 
1044                              db.commit() 
1045                              tfile = self.file_open(table._dbt, 'w') 
1046                              cPickle.dump(sql_fields_current, tfile) 
1047                              self.file_close(tfile) 
1048                              logfile.write('success!\n') 
1049                      else: 
1050                          logfile.write('faked!\n') 
1051              elif metadata_change: 
1052                  tfile = self.file_open(table._dbt, 'w') 
1053                  cPickle.dump(sql_fields_current, tfile) 
1054                  self.file_close(tfile) 
1055   
1056          if metadata_change and \ 
1057                  not (query and self.dbengine in ('mysql','oracle','firebird')): 
1058              db.commit() 
1059              tfile = self.file_open(table._dbt, 'w') 
1060              cPickle.dump(sql_fields_current, tfile) 
1061              self.file_close(tfile) 
1062

1113 -    def drop(self, table, mode=''): 

1114          db = table._db 
1115          if table._dbt: 
1116              logfile = self.file_open(table._loggername, 'a') 
1117          queries = self._drop(table, mode) 
1118          for query in queries: 
1119              if table._dbt: 
1120                  logfile.write(query + '\n') 
1121              self.execute(query) 
1122          db.commit() 
1123          del db[table._tablename] 
1124          del db.tables[db.tables.index(table._tablename)] 
1125          db._remove_references_to(table) 
1126          if table._dbt: 
1127              self.file_delete(table._dbt) 
1128              logfile.write('success!\n')

1135 -    def insert(self, table, fields): 

1136          query = self._insert(table,fields) 
1137          try: 
1138              self.execute(query) 
1139          except Exception, e: 
1140              if isinstance(e,self.integrity_error_class()): 
1141                  return None 
1142              raise e 
1143          if hasattr(table,'_primarykey'): 
1144              return dict([(k[0].name, k[1]) for k in fields \ 
1145                               if k[0].name in table._primarykey])

1147          if not isinstance(id,int): 
1148              return id 
1149          rid = Reference(id) 
1150          (rid._table, rid._record) = (table, None) 
1151          return rid

1194 -    def CONTAINS(self, first, second):

1196              key = '%'+str(second).replace('%','%%')+'%' 
1197          elif first.type.startswith('list:'): 
1198              key = '%|'+str(second).replace('|','||').replace('%','%%')+'|%' 
1199          return '(%s LIKE %s)' % (self.expand(first),self.expand(key,'string'))

1269 -    def expand(self, expression, field_type=None): 

1270          if isinstance(expression, Field): 
1271              return '%s.%s' % (expression.tablename, expression.name) 
1272          elif isinstance(expression, (Expression, Query)): 
1273              first = expression.first 
1274              second = expression.second 
1275              op = expression.op 
1276              if not second is None:  
1277                  return op(first, second) 
1278              elif not first is None: 
1279                  return op(first) 
1280              elif isinstance(op, str): 
1281                  if op.endswith(';'): 
1282                      op=op[:-1] 
1283                  return '(%s)' % op 
1284              else: 
1285                  return op() 
1286          elif field_type: 
1287              return str(self.represent(expression,field_type)) 
1288          elif isinstance(expression,(list,tuple)): 
1289              return ','.join(self.represent(item,field_type) \ 
1290                                  for item in expression) 
1291          elif isinstance(expression, bool): 
1292              return '1' if expression else '0' 
1293          else: 
1294              return str(expression)

1296 -    def alias(self, table, alias): 

1297          """ 
1298          Given a table object, makes a new table object 
1299          with alias name. 
1300          """ 
1301          other = copy.copy(table) 
1302          other['_ot'] = other._tablename 
1303          other['ALL'] = SQLALL(other) 
1304          other['_tablename'] = alias 
1305          for fieldname in other.fields: 
1306              other[fieldname] = copy.copy(other[fieldname]) 
1307              other[fieldname]._tablename = alias 
1308              other[fieldname].tablename = alias 
1309              other[fieldname].table = other 
1310          table._db[alias] = other 
1311          return other

1321          else: 
1322              class Logfile(object): 
1323                  def write(self, value): 
1324                      pass 

1325                  def close(self): 
1326                      pass 
1327              logfile = Logfile() 
1328   
1329          try: 
1330              queries = table._db._adapter._truncate(table, mode) 
1331              for query in queries: 
1332                  logfile.write(query + '\n') 
1333                  self.execute(query) 
1334              table._db.commit() 
1335              logfile.write('success!\n') 
1336          finally:

1418                      append(field) 
1419          return new_fields

1617 -    def tables(self, *queries): 

1618          tables = set() 
1619          for query in queries: 
1620              if isinstance(query, Field): 
1621                  tables.add(query.tablename) 
1622              elif isinstance(query, (Expression, Query)): 
1623                  if not query.first is None: 
1624                      tables = tables.union(self.tables(query.first)) 
1625                  if not query.second is None: 
1626                      tables = tables.union(self.tables(query.second)) 
1627          return list(tables)

1659 -    def log_execute(self, *a, **b): 

1660          command = a[0] 
1661          if self.db._debug: 
1662              logger.debug('SQL: %s' % command) 
1663          self.db._lastsql = command 
1664          t0 = time.time() 
1665          ret = self.cursor.execute(*a, **b) 
1666          self.db._timings.append((command,time.time()-t0)) 
1667          del self.db._timings[:-TIMINGSSIZE] 
1668          return ret

1673 -    def represent(self, obj, fieldtype): 

1674          field_is_type = fieldtype.startswith 
1675          if isinstance(obj, CALLABLETYPES): 
1676              obj = obj() 
1677          if isinstance(fieldtype, SQLCustomType): 
1678              value = fieldtype.encoder(obj) 
1679              if fieldtype.type in ('string','text'): 
1680                  return self.adapt(value) 
1681              return value 
1682          if isinstance(obj, (Expression, Field)): 
1683              return str(obj) 
1684          if field_is_type('list:'): 
1685              if not obj: 
1686                  obj = [] 
1687              elif not isinstance(obj, (list, tuple)): 
1688                  obj = [obj] 
1689              if field_is_type('list:string'): 
1690                  obj = [str(item) for item in obj] 
1691              else: 
1692                  obj = [int(item) for item in obj] 
1693          if isinstance(obj, (list, tuple)): 
1694              obj = bar_encode(obj) 
1695          if obj is None: 
1696              return 'NULL' 
1697          if obj == '' and not fieldtype[:2] in ['st', 'te', 'pa', 'up']: 
1698              return 'NULL' 
1699          r = self.represent_exceptions(obj, fieldtype) 
1700          if not r is None: 
1701              return r 
1702          if fieldtype == 'boolean': 
1703              if obj and not str(obj)[:1].upper() in ['F', '0']: 
1704                  return "'T'" 
1705              else: 
1706                  return "'F'" 
1707          if fieldtype == 'id' or fieldtype == 'integer': 
1708              return str(int(obj)) 
1709          if field_is_type('decimal'): 
1710              return str(obj) 
1711          elif field_is_type('reference'): # reference 
1712              if fieldtype.find('.')>0: 
1713                  return repr(obj) 
1714              elif isinstance(obj, (Row, Reference)): 
1715                  return str(obj['id']) 
1716              return str(int(obj)) 
1717          elif fieldtype == 'double': 
1718              return repr(float(obj)) 
1719          if isinstance(obj, unicode): 
1720              obj = obj.encode(self.db_codec) 
1721          if fieldtype == 'blob': 
1722              obj = base64.b64encode(str(obj)) 
1723          elif fieldtype == 'date': 
1724              if isinstance(obj, (datetime.date, datetime.datetime)): 
1725                  obj = obj.isoformat()[:10] 
1726              else: 
1727                  obj = str(obj) 
1728          elif fieldtype == 'datetime': 
1729              if isinstance(obj, datetime.datetime): 
1730                  obj = obj.isoformat()[:19].replace('T',' ') 
1731              elif isinstance(obj, datetime.date): 
1732                  obj = obj.isoformat()[:10]+' 00:00:00' 
1733              else: 
1734                  obj = str(obj) 
1735          elif fieldtype == 'time': 
1736              if isinstance(obj, datetime.time): 
1737                  obj = obj.isoformat()[:10] 
1738              else: 
1739                  obj = str(obj) 
1740          if not isinstance(obj,str): 
1741              obj = str(obj) 
1742          try: 
1743              obj.decode(self.db_codec) 
1744          except: 
1745              obj = obj.decode('latin1').encode(self.db_codec) 
1746          return self.adapt(obj) 

1747   

1748 -    def represent_exceptions(self, obj, fieldtype): 

1749          return None

1764 -    def parse_value(self, value, field_type, blob_decode=True): 

1765          if field_type != 'blob' and isinstance(value, str): 
1766              try: 
1767                  value = value.decode(self.db._db_codec) 
1768              except Exception: 
1769                  pass 
1770          if isinstance(value, unicode): 
1771              value = value.encode('utf-8') 
1772          if isinstance(field_type, SQLCustomType): 
1773              value = field_type.decoder(value) 
1774          if not isinstance(field_type, str) or value is None: 
1775              return value 
1776          elif field_type in ('string', 'text', 'password', 'upload', 'dict'): 
1777              return value 
1778          elif field_type.startswith('geo'): 
1779              return value 
1780          elif field_type == 'blob' and not blob_decode: 
1781              return value 
1782          else: 
1783              key = REGEX_TYPE.match(field_type).group(0) 
1784              return self.parsemap[key](value,field_type)

1796 -    def parse_date(self, value, field_type): 

1797          if not isinstance(value, (datetime.date,datetime.datetime)): 
1798              (y, m, d) = map(int, str(value)[:10].strip().split('-')) 
1799              value = datetime.date(y, m, d) 
1800          return value 

1801   

1802 -    def parse_time(self, value, field_type): 

1803          if not isinstance(value, datetime.time): 
1804              time_items = map(int,str(value)[:8].strip().split(':')[:3]) 
1805              if len(time_items) == 3: 
1806                  (h, mi, s) = time_items 
1807              else: 
1808                  (h, mi, s) = time_items + [0] 
1809              value = datetime.time(h, mi, s) 
1810          return value 

1811   

1812 -    def parse_datetime(self, value, field_type): 

1813          if not isinstance(value, datetime.datetime): 
1814              value = str(value) 
1815              date_part,time_part,timezone = value[:10],value[11:19],value[19:] 
1816              if '+' in timezone: 
1817                  ms,tz = timezone.split('+') 
1818                  h,m = tz.split(':') 
1819                  dt = datetime.timedelta(seconds=3600*int(h)+60*int(m)) 
1820              elif '-' in timezone: 
1821                  ms,tz = timezone.split('-') 
1822                  h,m = tz.split(':') 
1823                  dt = -datetime.timedelta(seconds=3600*int(h)+60*int(m)) 
1824              else: 
1825                  dt = None 
1826              (y, m, d) = map(int,date_part.split('-')) 
1827              time_parts = time_part and time_part.split(':')[:3] or (0,0,0) 
1828              while len(time_parts)<3: time_parts.append(0) 
1829              time_items = map(int,time_parts) 
1830              (h, mi, s) = time_items 
1831              value = datetime.datetime(y, m, d, h, mi, s) 
1832              if dt: 
1833                  value = value + dt 
1834          return value 

1835   

1836 -    def parse_blob(self, value, field_type): 

1837          return base64.b64decode(str(value)) 

1838   

1839 -    def parse_decimal(self, value, field_type):

1841          if self.dbengine in ('sqlite', 'spatialite'): 
1842              value = ('%.' + str(decimals) + 'f') % value 
1843          if not isinstance(value, decimal.Decimal): 
1844              value = decimal.Decimal(str(value)) 
1845          return value

1890 -    def parse(self, rows, fields, colnames, blob_decode=True, 
1891                cacheable = False): 

1892          self.build_parsemap() 
1893          db = self.db 
1894          virtualtables = [] 
1895          new_rows = [] 
1896          tmps = [] 
1897          for colname in colnames: 
1898              if not REGEX_TABLE_DOT_FIELD.match(colname): 
1899                  tmps.append(None) 
1900              else: 
1901                  (tablename, fieldname) = colname.split('.') 
1902                  table = db[tablename] 
1903                  field = table[fieldname] 
1904                  ft = field.type 
1905                  tmps.append((tablename,fieldname,table,field,ft)) 
1906          for (i,row) in enumerate(rows): 
1907              new_row = Row() 
1908              for (j,colname) in enumerate(colnames): 
1909                  value = row[j]                 
1910                  tmp = tmps[j] 
1911                  if tmp: 
1912                      (tablename,fieldname,table,field,ft) = tmp 
1913                      if tablename in new_row: 
1914                          colset = new_row[tablename] 
1915                      else: 
1916                          colset = new_row[tablename] = Row() 
1917                          if tablename not in virtualtables: 
1918                              virtualtables.append(tablename) 
1919                      value = self.parse_value(value,ft,blob_decode) 
1920                      if field.filter_out: 
1921                          value = field.filter_out(value) 
1922                      colset[fieldname] = value 
1923                                           
1924                      # for backward compatibility 
1925                      if ft=='id' and fieldname!='id' and \ 
1926                              not 'id' in table.fields: 
1927                          colset['id'] = value 
1928   
1929                      if ft == 'id' and not cacheable: 
1930                          # temporary hack to deal with  
1931                          # GoogleDatastoreAdapter 
1932                          # references 
1933                          if isinstance(self, GoogleDatastoreAdapter): 
1934                              id = value.key().id_or_name() 
1935                              colset[fieldname] = id 
1936                              colset.gae_item = value 
1937                          else: 
1938                              id = value 
1939                          colset.update_record = RecordUpdater(colset,table,id) 
1940                          colset.delete_record = RecordDeleter(table,id) 
1941                          for rfield in table._referenced_by: 
1942                              referee_link = db._referee_name and \ 
1943                                  db._referee_name % dict( 
1944                                  table=rfield.tablename,field=rfield.name) 
1945                              if referee_link and not referee_link in colset: 
1946                                  colset[referee_link] = Set(db,rfield == id) 
1947                  else: 
1948                      if not '_extra' in new_row: 
1949                          new_row['_extra'] = Row() 
1950                      new_row['_extra'][colname] = \ 
1951                          self.parse_value(value, 
1952                                           fields[j].type,blob_decode) 
1953                      new_column_name = \ 
1954                          REGEX_SELECT_AS_PARSER.search(colname) 
1955                      if not new_column_name is None: 
1956                          column_name = new_column_name.groups(0) 
1957                          setattr(new_row,column_name[0],value) 
1958              new_rows.append(new_row) 
1959          rowsobj = Rows(db, new_rows, colnames, rawrows=rows) 
1960   
1961          for tablename in virtualtables: 
1962              ### new style virtual fields 
1963              table = db[tablename] 
1964              fields_virtual = [(f,v) for (f,v) in table.iteritems() 
1965                                if isinstance(v,FieldVirtual)] 
1966              fields_lazy = [(f,v) for (f,v) in table.iteritems() 
1967                             if isinstance(v,FieldLazy)] 
1968              if fields_virtual or fields_lazy: 
1969                  for row in rowsobj.records: 
1970                      box = row[tablename] 
1971                      for f,v in fields_virtual: 
1972                          box[f] = v.f(row) 
1973                      for f,v in fields_lazy: 
1974                          box[f] = (v.handler or VirtualCommand)(v.f,row) 
1975   
1976              ### old style virtual fields 
1977              for item in table.virtualfields: 
1978                  try: 
1979                      rowsobj = rowsobj.setvirtualfields(**{tablename:item}) 
1980                  except (KeyError, AttributeError): 
1981                      # to avoid breaking virtualfields when partial select 
1982                      pass 
1983          return rowsobj 

1984   

1985 -    def common_filter(self, query, tablenames): 

1986          tenant_fieldname = self.db._request_tenant 
1987   
1988          for tablename in tablenames: 
1989              table = self.db[tablename] 
1990   
1991              # deal with user provided filters 
1992              if table._common_filter != None: 
1993                  query = query & table._common_filter(query) 
1994   
1995              # deal with multi_tenant filters 
1996              if tenant_fieldname in table: 
1997                  default = table[tenant_fieldname].default 
1998                  if not default is None: 
1999                      newquery = table[tenant_fieldname] == default 
2000                      if query is None: 
2001                          query = newquery 
2002                      else: 
2003                          query = query & newquery 
2004          return query

2086 -    def select(self, query, fields, attributes): 

2087          """ 
2088          Simulate SELECT ... FOR UPDATE with BEGIN IMMEDIATE TRANSACTION. 
2089          Note that the entire database, rather than one record, is locked 
2090          (it will be locked eventually anyway by the following UPDATE). 
2091          """ 
2092          if attributes.get('for_update', False) and not 'cache' in attributes: 
2093              self.execute('BEGIN IMMEDIATE TRANSACTION;') 
2094          return super(SQLiteAdapter, self).select(query, fields, attributes)

2763 -    def represent_exceptions(self, obj, fieldtype): 

2764          if fieldtype == 'blob': 
2765              obj = base64.b64encode(str(obj)) 
2766              return ":CLOB('%s')" % obj 
2767          elif fieldtype == 'date': 
2768              if isinstance(obj, (datetime.date, datetime.datetime)): 
2769                  obj = obj.isoformat()[:10] 
2770              else: 
2771                  obj = str(obj) 
2772              return "to_date('%s','yyyy-mm-dd')" % obj

2775                  obj = obj.isoformat()[:19].replace('T',' ')

2777                  obj = obj.isoformat()[:10]+' 00:00:00'

2806      oracle_fix = re.compile("[^']*('[^']*'[^']*)*\:(?P<clob>CLOB\('([^']+|'')*'\))") 
2807   

2808 -    def execute(self, command, args=None): 

2809          args = args or [] 
2810          i = 1 
2811          while True: 
2812              m = self.oracle_fix.match(command) 
2813              if not m: 
2814                  break 
2815              command = command[:m.start('clob')] + str(i) + command[m.end('clob'):] 
2816              args.append(m.group('clob')[6:-2].replace("''", "'")) 
2817              i += 1 
2818          if command[-1:]==';': 
2819              command = command[:-1] 
2820          return self.log_execute(command, args)

2822 -    def create_sequence_and_triggers(self, query, table, **args): 

2823          tablename = table._tablename 
2824          sequence_name = table._sequence_name 
2825          trigger_name = table._trigger_name 
2826          self.execute(query) 
2827          self.execute('CREATE SEQUENCE %s START WITH 1 INCREMENT BY 1 NOMAXVALUE MINVALUE -1;' % sequence_name) 
2828          self.execute(""" 
2829              CREATE OR REPLACE TRIGGER %(trigger_name)s BEFORE INSERT ON %(tablename)s FOR EACH ROW 
2830              DECLARE 
2831                  curr_val NUMBER; 
2832                  diff_val NUMBER; 
2833                  PRAGMA autonomous_transaction; 
2834              BEGIN 
2835                  IF :NEW.id IS NOT NULL THEN 
2836                      EXECUTE IMMEDIATE 'SELECT %(sequence_name)s.nextval FROM dual' INTO curr_val; 
2837                      diff_val := :NEW.id - curr_val - 1; 
2838                      IF diff_val != 0 THEN 
2839                        EXECUTE IMMEDIATE 'alter sequence %(sequence_name)s increment by '|| diff_val; 
2840                        EXECUTE IMMEDIATE 'SELECT %(sequence_name)s.nextval FROM dual' INTO curr_val; 
2841                        EXECUTE IMMEDIATE 'alter sequence %(sequence_name)s increment by 1'; 
2842                      END IF; 
2843                  END IF; 
2844                  SELECT %(sequence_name)s.nextval INTO :NEW.id FROM DUAL; 
2845              END; 
2846          """ % dict(trigger_name=trigger_name, tablename=tablename, sequence_name=sequence_name)) 

2847   

2848 -    def lastrowid(self,table): 

2849          sequence_name = table._sequence_name 
2850          self.execute('SELECT %s.currval FROM dual;' % sequence_name) 
2851          return int(self.cursor.fetchone()[0])

2856                  value = value.read() 
2857              except self.driver.ProgrammingError: 
2858                  # After a subsequent fetch the LOB value is not valid anymore 
2859                  pass

2881          'reference': 'INT NULL, CONSTRAINT %(constraint_name)s FOREIGN KEY (%(field_name)s) REFERENCES %(foreign_key)s ON DELETE %(on_delete_action)s', 
2882          'list:integer': 'TEXT', 
2883          'list:string': 'TEXT', 
2884          'list:reference': 'TEXT', 
2885          'geometry': 'geometry', 
2886          'geography': 'geography', 
2887          'big-id': 'BIGINT IDENTITY PRIMARY KEY',

2889          'reference FK': ', CONSTRAINT FK_%(constraint_name)s FOREIGN KEY (%(field_name)s) REFERENCES %(foreign_key)s ON DELETE %(on_delete_action)s', 
2890          'reference TFK': ' CONSTRAINT FK_%(foreign_table)s_PK FOREIGN KEY (%(field_name)s) REFERENCES %(foreign_table)s (%(foreign_key)s) ON DELETE %(on_delete_action)s',

2933      REGEX_DSN = re.compile('^(?P<dsn>.+)$')

2937 -    def __init__(self,db,uri,pool_size=0,folder=None,db_codec ='UTF-8', 
2938                   credential_decoder=IDENTITY, driver_args={}, 
2939                      adapter_args={}, fake_connect=False, srid=4326): 

2940          self.db = db 
2941          self.dbengine = "mssql" 
2942          self.uri = uri 
2943          self.find_driver(adapter_args,uri) 
2944          self.pool_size = pool_size 
2945          self.folder = folder 
2946          self.db_codec = db_codec 
2947          self.srid = srid 
2948          self.find_or_make_work_folder() 
2949          # ## read: http://bytes.com/groups/python/460325-cx_oracle-utf8 
2950          ruri = uri.split('://',1)[1] 
2951          if '@' not in ruri: 
2952              try: 
2953                  m = self.REGEX_DSN.match(ruri) 
2954                  if not m: 
2955                      raise SyntaxError, \ 
2956                          'Parsing uri string(%s) has no result' % self.uri 
2957                  dsn = m.group('dsn') 
2958                  if not dsn: 
2959                      raise SyntaxError, 'DSN required' 
2960              except SyntaxError, e: 
2961                  logger.error('NdGpatch error') 
2962                  raise e 
2963              # was cnxn = 'DSN=%s' % dsn 
2964              cnxn = dsn 
2965          else: 
2966              m = self.REGEX_URI.match(ruri) 
2967              if not m: 
2968                  raise SyntaxError, \ 
2969                      "Invalid URI string in DAL: %s" % self.uri 
2970              user = credential_decoder(m.group('user')) 
2971              if not user: 
2972                  raise SyntaxError, 'User required' 
2973              password = credential_decoder(m.group('password')) 
2974              if not password: 
2975                  password = '' 
2976              host = m.group('host') 
2977              if not host: 
2978                  raise SyntaxError, 'Host name required' 
2979              db = m.group('db') 
2980              if not db: 
2981                  raise SyntaxError, 'Database name required' 
2982              port = m.group('port') or '1433' 
2983              # Parse the optional url name-value arg pairs after the '?' 
2984              # (in the form of arg1=value1&arg2=value2&...) 
2985              # Default values (drivers like FreeTDS insist on uppercase parameter keys) 
2986              argsdict = { 'DRIVER':'{SQL Server}' } 
2987              urlargs = m.group('urlargs') or ''             
2988              for argmatch in self.REGEX_ARGPATTERN.finditer(urlargs): 
2989                  argsdict[str(argmatch.group('argkey')).upper()] = argmatch.group('argvalue') 
2990              urlargs = ';'.join(['%s=%s' % (ak, av) for (ak, av) in argsdict.iteritems()]) 
2991              cnxn = 'SERVER=%s;PORT=%s;DATABASE=%s;UID=%s;PWD=%s;%s' \ 
2992                  % (host, port, db, user, password, urlargs) 
2993          def connect(cnxn=cnxn,driver_args=driver_args): 
2994              return self.driver.connect(cnxn,**driver_args) 

2995          if not fake_connect: 
2996              self.pool_connection(connect) 
2997              self.after_connection() 

2998

3379          'reference TFK': 'FOREIGN KEY (%(field_name)s) REFERENCES %(foreign_table)s (%(foreign_key)s) ON DELETE %(on_delete_action)s CONSTRAINT TFK_%(table_name)s_%(field_name)s', 
3380          } 
3381   

3382 -    def RANDOM(self):

3384   

3385 -    def NOT_NULL(self,default,field_type): 

3386          return 'DEFAULT %s NOT NULL' % self.represent(default,field_type)

3388 -    def select_limitby(self, sql_s, sql_f, sql_t, sql_w, sql_o, limitby): 

3389          if limitby: 
3390              (lmin, lmax) = limitby 
3391              fetch_amt = lmax - lmin 
3392              dbms_version = int(self.connection.dbms_version.split('.')[0]) 
3393              if lmin and (dbms_version >= 10): 
3394                  # Requires Informix 10.0+ 
3395                  sql_s += ' SKIP %d' % (lmin, ) 
3396              if fetch_amt and (dbms_version >= 9): 
3397                  # Requires Informix 9.0+ 
3398                  sql_s += ' FIRST %d' % (fetch_amt, ) 
3399          return 'SELECT %s %s FROM %s%s%s;' % (sql_s, sql_f, sql_t, sql_w, sql_o)

3401 -    def represent_exceptions(self, obj, fieldtype): 

3402          if fieldtype == 'date': 
3403              if isinstance(obj, (datetime.date, datetime.datetime)): 
3404                  obj = obj.isoformat()[:10] 
3405              else: 
3406                  obj = str(obj) 
3407              return "to_date('%s','%%Y-%%m-%%d')" % obj 
3408          elif fieldtype == 'datetime': 
3409              if isinstance(obj, datetime.datetime): 
3410                  obj = obj.isoformat()[:19].replace('T',' ') 
3411              elif isinstance(obj, datetime.date): 
3412                  obj = obj.isoformat()[:10]+' 00:00:00' 
3413              else: 
3414                  obj = str(obj) 
3415              return "to_date('%s','%%Y-%%m-%%d %%H:%%M:%%S')" % obj 
3416          return None

3418      REGEX_URI = re.compile('^(?P<user>[^:@]+)(\:(?P<password>[^@]*))?@(?P<host>[^\:/]+)(\:(?P<port>[0-9]+))?/(?P<db>.+)$')

3420 -    def __init__(self,db,uri,pool_size=0,folder=None,db_codec ='UTF-8', 
3421                   credential_decoder=IDENTITY, driver_args={}, 
3422                   adapter_args={}):

3424          self.dbengine = "informix" 
3425          self.uri = uri 
3426          self.find_driver(adapter_args,uri) 
3427          self.pool_size = pool_size 
3428          self.folder = folder 
3429          self.db_codec = db_codec 
3430          self.find_or_make_work_folder() 
3431          ruri = uri.split('://',1)[1] 
3432          m = self.REGEX_URI.match(ruri) 
3433          if not m: 
3434              raise SyntaxError, \ 
3435                  "Invalid URI string in DAL: %s" % self.uri 
3436          user = credential_decoder(m.group('user')) 
3437          if not user: 
3438              raise SyntaxError, 'User required' 
3439          password = credential_decoder(m.group('password')) 
3440          if not password: 
3441              password = '' 
3442          host = m.group('host') 
3443          if not host: 
3444              raise SyntaxError, 'Host name required' 
3445          db = m.group('db') 
3446          if not db: 
3447              raise SyntaxError, 'Database name required' 
3448          user = credential_decoder(user) 
3449          password = credential_decoder(password) 
3450          dsn = '%s@%s' % (db,host) 
3451          driver_args.update(user=user,password=password,autocommit=True) 
3452          def connect(dsn=dsn,driver_args=driver_args): 
3453              return self.driver.connect(dsn,**driver_args) 

3454          self.pool_connection(connect) 
3455          self.after_connection()

3700              modify_tbl_sql = 'modify %s to btree unique on %s' % \ 
3701                  (table._tablename,

3707              self.execute('create sequence %s' % tmp_seqname)

4037                  return obj 
4038          is_string = isinstance(fieldtype,str) 
4039          is_list = is_string and field_is_type('list:') 
4040          if is_list: 
4041              if not obj: 
4042                  obj = [] 
4043              if not isinstance(obj, (list, tuple)): 
4044                  obj = [obj] 
4045          if obj == '' and not \ 
4046                  (is_string and fieldtype[:2] in ['st','te','pa','up']): 
4047              return None 
4048          if not obj is None: 
4049              if isinstance(obj, list) and not is_list: 
4050                  obj = [self.represent(o, fieldtype) for o in obj]

4052                  obj = long(obj) 
4053              elif fieldtype == 'double': 
4054                  obj = float(obj) 
4055              elif is_string and field_is_type('reference'): 
4056                  if isinstance(obj, (Row, Reference)): 
4057                      obj = obj['id'] 
4058                  obj = long(obj) 
4059              elif fieldtype == 'boolean': 
4060                  if obj and not str(obj)[0].upper() == 'F': 
4061                      obj = True 
4062                  else: 
4063                      obj = False 
4064              elif fieldtype == 'date': 
4065                  if not isinstance(obj, datetime.date): 
4066                      (y, m, d) = map(int,str(obj).strip().split('-')) 
4067                      obj = datetime.date(y, m, d) 
4068                  elif isinstance(obj,datetime.datetime): 
4069                      (y, m, d) = (obj.year, obj.month, obj.day) 
4070                      obj = datetime.date(y, m, d) 
4071              elif fieldtype == 'time': 
4072                  if not isinstance(obj, datetime.time): 
4073                      time_items = map(int,str(obj).strip().split(':')[:3]) 
4074                      if len(time_items) == 3: 
4075                          (h, mi, s) = time_items 
4076                      else: 
4077                          (h, mi, s) = time_items + [0] 
4078                      obj = datetime.time(h, mi, s)

4080                  if not isinstance(obj, datetime.datetime): 
4081                      (y, m, d) = map(int,str(obj)[:10].strip().split('-'))

4083                      while len(time_items)<3: 
4084                          time_items.append(0) 
4085                      (h, mi, s) = time_items

4088                  pass
