4401   
4402          #tableobj is a GAE Model class (or subclass) 
4403          tableobj = db[tablename]._tableobj 
4404          filters = self.expand(query) 
4405   
4406          projection = None 
4407          if len(db[tablename].fields) == len(fields): 
4408              #getting all fields, not a projection query 
4409              projection = None 
4410          elif args_get('projection') == True: 
4411              projection = [] 
4412              for f in fields: 
4413                  if f.type in ['text', 'blob']: 
4414                      raise SyntaxError, \ 
4415                      "text and blob field types not allowed in projection queries" 
4416                  else: 
4417                      projection.append(f.name) 
4418   
4419          # projection's can't include 'id'.  
4420          # it will be added to the result later 
4421          query_projection = [ 
4422              p for p in projection if \ 
4423                  p != db[tablename]._id.name] if projection \ 
4424                  else None 
4425   
4426          cursor = None 
4427          if isinstance(args_get('reusecursor'), str): 
4428              cursor = args_get('reusecursor') 
4429          items = gae.Query(tableobj, projection=query_projection, 
4430                            cursor=cursor) 
4431   
4432          for filter in filters: 
4433              if args_get('projection') == True and \ 
4434                 filter.name in query_projection and \ 
4435                 filter.op in ['=', '<=', '>=']: 
4436                  raise SyntaxError, \ 
4437                  "projection fields cannot have equality filters" 
4438              if filter.name=='__key__' and filter.op=='>' and filter.value==0: 
4439                  continue 
4440              elif filter.name=='__key__' and filter.op=='=': 
4441                  if filter.value==0: 
4442                      items = [] 
4443                  elif isinstance(filter.value, Key): 
4444                      # key qeuries return a class instance, 
4445                      # can't use projection 
4446                      # extra values will be ignored in post-processing later 
4447                      item = tableobj.get(filter.value) 
4448                      items = (item and [item]) or [] 
4449                  else: 
4450                      # key qeuries return a class instance, 
4451                      # can't use projection 
4452                      # extra values will be ignored in post-processing later 
4453                      item = tableobj.get_by_id(filter.value) 
4454                      items = (item and [item]) or [] 
4455              elif isinstance(items,list): # i.e. there is a single record! 
4456                  items = [i for i in items if filter.apply( 
4457                          getattr(item,filter.name),filter.value)] 
4458              else: 
4459                  if filter.name=='__key__' and filter.op != 'in': 
4460                      items.order('__key__') 
4461                  items = items.filter('%s %s' % (filter.name,filter.op), 
4462                                       filter.value) 
4463          if not isinstance(items,list): 
4464              if args_get('left', None): 
4465                  raise SyntaxError, 'Set: no left join in appengine' 
4466              if args_get('groupby', None): 
4467                  raise SyntaxError, 'Set: no groupby in appengine' 
4468              orderby = args_get('orderby', False) 
4469              if orderby: 
4470                  ### THIS REALLY NEEDS IMPROVEMENT !!! 
4471                  if isinstance(orderby, (list, tuple)): 
4472                      orderby = xorify(orderby) 
4473                  if isinstance(orderby,Expression): 
4474                      orderby = self.expand(orderby) 
4475                  orders = orderby.split(', ') 
4476                  for order in orders: 
4477                      order={'-id':'-__key__','id':'__key__'}.get(order,order) 
4478                      items = items.order(order) 
4479              if args_get('limitby', None): 
4480                  (lmin, lmax) = attributes['limitby'] 
4481                  (limit, offset) = (lmax - lmin, lmin) 
4482                  rows = items.fetch(limit,offset=offset) 
4483                  #cursor is only useful if there was a limit and we didn't return 
4484                  # all results 
4485                  if args_get('reusecursor'): 
4486                      db['_lastcursor'] = items.cursor() 
4487                  items = rows 
4488          return (items, tablename, projection or db[tablename].fields) 

4489   

4490 -    def select(self,query,fields,attributes): 

4491          """ 
4492          This is the GAE version of select.  some notes to consider: 
4493           - db['_lastsql'] is not set because there is not SQL statement string 
4494             for a GAE query 
4495           - 'nativeRef' is a magical fieldname used for self references on GAE 
4496           - optional attribute 'projection' when set to True will trigger 
4497             use of the GAE projection queries.  note that there are rules for 
4498             what is accepted imposed by GAE: each field must be indexed, 
4499             projection queries cannot contain blob or text fields, and you 
4500             cannot use == and also select that same field.  see https://developers.google.com/appengine/docs/python/datastore/queries#Query_Projection 
4501           - optional attribute 'reusecursor' allows use of cursor with queries 
4502             that have the limitby attribute.  Set the attribute to True for the 
4503             first query, set it to the value of db['_lastcursor'] to continue 
4504             a previous query.  The user must save the cursor value between 
4505             requests, and the filters must be identical.  It is up to the user 
4506             to follow google's limitations: https://developers.google.com/appengine/docs/python/datastore/queries#Query_Cursors 
4507          """ 
4508   
4509          (items, tablename, fields) = self.select_raw(query,fields,attributes) 
4510          # self.db['_lastsql'] = self._select(query,fields,attributes) 
4511          rows = [[(t==self.db[tablename]._id.name and item) or \ 
4512                   (t=='nativeRef' and item) or getattr(item, t) \ 
4513                       for t in fields] for item in items] 
4514          colnames = ['%s.%s' % (tablename, t) for t in fields] 
4515          processor = attributes.get('processor',self.parse) 
4516          return processor(rows,fields,colnames,False) 

4517   

4518 -    def count(self,query,distinct=None): 

4519          if distinct: 
4520              raise RuntimeError, "COUNT DISTINCT not supported" 
4521          (items, tablename, fields) = self.select_raw(query) 
4522          # self.db['_lastsql'] = self._count(query) 
4523          try: 
4524              return len(items) 
4525          except TypeError: 
4526              return items.count(limit=None) 

4527   

4528 -    def delete(self,tablename, query): 

4529          """ 
4530          This function was changed on 2010-05-04 because according to 
4531          http://code.google.com/p/googleappengine/issues/detail?id=3119 
4532          GAE no longer supports deleting more than 1000 records. 
4533          """ 
4534          # self.db['_lastsql'] = self._delete(tablename,query) 
4535          (items, tablename, fields) = self.select_raw(query) 
4536          # items can be one item or a query 
4537          if not isinstance(items,list): 
4538              counter = items.count(limit=None) 
4539              leftitems = items.fetch(1000) 
4540              while len(leftitems): 
4541                  gae.delete(leftitems) 
4542                  leftitems = items.fetch(1000) 
4543          else: 
4544              counter = len(items) 
4545              gae.delete(items) 
4546          return counter 

4547   

4548 -    def update(self,tablename,query,update_fields):

4551          counter = 0 
4552          for item in items: 
4553              for field, value in update_fields: 
4554                  setattr(item, field.name, self.represent(value,field.type)) 
4555              item.put() 
4556              counter += 1 
4557          logger.info(str(counter)) 
4558          return counter 

4559

4564          tmp.put() 
4565          rid = Reference(tmp.key().id()) 
4566          (rid._table, rid._record, rid._gaekey) = (table, None, tmp.key())

4861 -    def represent(self, obj, fieldtype): 

4862          value = NoSQLAdapter.represent(self, obj, fieldtype) 
4863          if fieldtype  =='date': 
4864              if value == None: 
4865                  return value 
4866              t = datetime.time(0, 0, 0)#this piece of data can be stripped of based on the fieldtype 
4867              return datetime.datetime.combine(value, t) #mongodb doesn't has a date object and so it must datetime, string or integer 
4868          elif fieldtype == 'time': 
4869              if value == None: 
4870                  return value 
4871              d = datetime.date(2000, 1, 1) #this piece of data can be stripped of based on the fieldtype 
4872              return datetime.datetime.combine(d, value) #mongodb doesn't has a  time object and so it must datetime, string or integer 
4873          elif fieldtype == 'list:string' or fieldtype == 'list:integer' or fieldtype == 'list:reference': 
4874              return value #raise SyntaxError, "Not Supported" 
4875          return value

4903 -    def expand(self, expression, field_type=None): 

4904          try: 
4905              from pymongo.objectid import ObjectId 
4906          except ImportError: 
4907              from bson.objectid import ObjectId 
4908          #if isinstance(expression,Field): 
4909          #    if expression.type=='id': 
4910          #        return {_id}" 
4911          if isinstance(expression, Query): 
4912              print "in expand and this is a query" 
4913              # any query using 'id':= 
4914              #   set name as _id (as per pymongo/mongodb primary key) 
4915              # convert second arg to an objectid field  
4916              # (if its not already) 
4917              # if second arg is 0 convert to objectid 
4918              if isinstance(expression.first,Field) and \ 
4919                      expression.first.type == 'id': 
4920                  expression.first.name = '_id' 
4921                  if expression.second != 0 and \ 
4922                          not isinstance(expression.second,ObjectId): 
4923                      if isinstance(expression.second,int): 
4924                          try: 
4925                              # Because the reference field is by default  
4926                              # an integer and therefore this must be an  
4927                              # integer to be able to work with other  
4928                              # databases 
4929                              expression.second = ObjectId(("%X" % expression.second)) 
4930                          except: 
4931                              raise SyntaxError, 'The second argument must by an integer that can represent an objectid.' 
4932                      else: 
4933                          try: 
4934                              #But a direct id is also possible 
4935                              expression.second = ObjectId(expression.second) 
4936                          except: 
4937                              raise SyntaxError, 'second argument must be of type ObjectId or an objectid representable integer' 
4938                  elif expression.second == 0: 
4939                      expression.second = ObjectId('000000000000000000000000') 
4940                  return expression.op(expression.first, expression.second) 
4941          if isinstance(expression, Field): 
4942              if expression.type=='id': 
4943                  return "_id" 
4944              else: 
4945                  return expression.name 
4946              #return expression 
4947          elif isinstance(expression, (Expression, Query)): 
4948              if not expression.second is None: 
4949                  return expression.op(expression.first, expression.second) 
4950              elif not expression.first is None: 
4951                  return expression.op(expression.first) 
4952              elif not isinstance(expression.op, str): 
4953                  return expression.op() 
4954              else: 
4955                  return expression.op 
4956          elif field_type: 
4957              return str(self.represent(expression,field_type)) 
4958          elif isinstance(expression,(list,tuple)): 
4959              return ','.join(self.represent(item,field_type) for item in expression) 
4960          else: 
4961              return expression

4967              from pymongo.son import SON 
4968   
4969          for key in set(attributes.keys())-set(('limitby','orderby')): 
4970              if attributes[key]!=None: 
4971                  raise SyntaxError, 'invalid select attribute: %s' % key 
4972   
4973          new_fields=[] 
4974          mongosort_list = [] 
4975   
4976          # try an orderby attribute 
4977          orderby = attributes.get('orderby', False) 
4978          limitby = attributes.get('limitby', False) 
4979          #distinct = attributes.get('distinct', False) 
4980          if orderby: 
4981              #print "in if orderby %s" % orderby 
4982              if isinstance(orderby, (list, tuple)): 
4983                  orderby = xorify(orderby) 
4984   
4985              # !!!! need to add 'random' 
4986              for f in self.expand(orderby).split(','): 
4987                  if f.startswith('-'): 
4988                      mongosort_list.append((f[1:],-1)) 
4989                  else: 
4990                      mongosort_list.append((f,1)) 
4991   
4992          if limitby: 
4993              limitby_skip, limitby_limit = limitby 
4994          else: 
4995              limitby_skip = limitby_limit = 0 
4996   
4997          mongofields_dict = SON() 
4998          mongoqry_dict = {} 
4999          for item in fields: 
5000              if isinstance(item,SQLALL): 
5001                  new_fields += item._table 
5002              else: 
5003                  new_fields.append(item) 
5004          fields = new_fields 
5005          if isinstance(query,Query): 
5006              tablename = self.get_table(query) 
5007          elif len(fields) != 0: 
5008              tablename = fields[0].tablename 
5009          else: 
5010              raise SyntaxError, "The table name could not be found in the query nor from the select statement." 
5011          mongoqry_dict = self.expand(query) 
5012          fields = fields or self.db[tablename] 
5013          for field in fields: 
5014              mongofields_dict[field.name] = 1 
5015          return tablename, mongoqry_dict, mongofields_dict, \ 
5016              mongosort_list, limitby_limit, limitby_skip

5026          mongosort_list, limitby_limit, limitby_skip = \

5031                      mongoqry_dict, mongofields_dict,

5033                      sort=mongosort_list, snapshot=snapshot).count()}

5036                  mongoqry_dict, mongofields_dict, 
5037                  skip=limitby_skip, limit=limitby_limit, 
5038                  sort=mongosort_list, snapshot=snapshot) # pymongo cursor object

5049                          record[column],ObjectId):

5051                      elif column != '_id': 
5052                          value = record[column] 
5053                      else: 
5054                          value = None 
5055                  else: 
5056                      value = None 
5057                  row.append(value) 
5058              rows.append(row) 
5059          processor = attributes.get('processor',self.parse) 
5060          return processor(rows,fields,colnames,False)

5384   

5385 -class IMAPAdapter(NoSQLAdapter): 

5386      drivers = ('imaplib',) 
5387   
5388      """ IMAP server adapter 
5389   
5390        This class is intended as an interface with 
5391      email IMAP servers to perform simple queries in the 
5392      web2py DAL query syntax, so email read, search and 
5393      other related IMAP mail services (as those implemented 
5394      by brands like Google(r), and Yahoo!(r) 
5395      can be managed from web2py applications. 
5396   
5397      The code uses examples by Yuji Tomita on this post: 
5398      http://yuji.wordpress.com/2011/06/22/python-imaplib-imap-example-with-gmail/#comment-1137 
5399      and is based in docs for Python imaplib, python email 
5400      and email IETF's (i.e. RFC2060 and RFC3501) 
5401   
5402      This adapter was tested with a small set of operations with Gmail(r). Other 
5403      services requests could raise command syntax and response data issues. 
5404   
5405      It creates its table and field names "statically", 
5406      meaning that the developer should leave the table and field 
5407      definitions to the DAL instance by calling the adapter's 
5408      .define_tables() method. The tables are defined with the 
5409      IMAP server mailbox list information. 
5410   
5411      .define_tables() returns a dictionary mapping dal tablenames 
5412      to the server mailbox names with the following structure: 
5413   
5414      {<tablename>: str <server mailbox name>} 
5415   
5416      Here is a list of supported fields: 
5417   
5418      Field       Type            Description 
5419      ################################################################ 
5420      uid         string 
5421      answered    boolean        Flag 
5422      created     date 
5423      content     list:string    A list of text or html parts 
5424      to          string 
5425      cc          string 
5426      bcc         string 
5427      size        integer        the amount of octets of the message* 
5428      deleted     boolean        Flag 
5429      draft       boolean        Flag 
5430      flagged     boolean        Flag 
5431      sender      string 
5432      recent      boolean        Flag 
5433      seen        boolean        Flag 
5434      subject     string 
5435      mime        string         The mime header declaration 
5436      email       string         The complete RFC822 message** 
5437      attachments list:string    Each non text decoded part as string 
5438   
5439      *At the application side it is measured as the length of the RFC822 
5440      message string 
5441   
5442      WARNING: As row id's are mapped to email sequence numbers, 
5443      make sure your imap client web2py app does not delete messages 
5444      during select or update actions, to prevent 
5445      updating or deleting different messages. 
5446      Sequence numbers change whenever the mailbox is updated. 
5447      To avoid this sequence numbers issues, it is recommended the use 
5448      of uid fields in query references (although the update and delete 
5449      in separate actions rule still applies). 
5450   
5451      # This is the code recommended to start imap support 
5452      # at the app's model: 
5453   
5454      imapdb = DAL("imap://user:password@server:port", pool_size=1) # port 993 for ssl 
5455      imapdb.define_tables() 
5456   
5457      Here is an (incomplete) list of possible imap commands: 
5458   
5459      # Count today's unseen messages 
5460      # smaller than 6000 octets from the 
5461      # inbox mailbox 
5462   
5463      q = imapdb.INBOX.seen == False 
5464      q &= imapdb.INBOX.created == datetime.date.today() 
5465      q &= imapdb.INBOX.size < 6000 
5466      unread = imapdb(q).count() 
5467   
5468      # Fetch last query messages 
5469      rows = imapdb(q).select() 
5470   
5471      # it is also possible to filter query select results with limitby and 
5472      # sequences of mailbox fields 
5473   
5474      set.select(<fields sequence>, limitby=(<int>, <int>)) 
5475   
5476      # Mark last query messages as seen 
5477      messages = [row.uid for row in rows] 
5478      seen = imapdb(imapdb.INBOX.uid.belongs(messages)).update(seen=True) 
5479   
5480      # Delete messages in the imap database that have mails from mr. Gumby 
5481   
5482      deleted = 0 
5483      for mailbox in imapdb.tables 
5484          deleted += imapdb(imapdb[mailbox].sender.contains("gumby")).delete() 
5485   
5486      # It is possible also to mark messages for deletion instead of ereasing them 
5487      # directly with set.update(deleted=True) 
5488   
5489   
5490      # This objects give access 
5491      # to the adapter auto mailbox 
5492      # mapped names (which native 
5493      # mailbox has what table name) 
5494   
5495      db.mailboxes <dict> # tablename, server native name 
5496      db.mailbox_names <dict> # server native name, tablename 
5497   
5498      """ 
5499   
5500      types = { 
5501                  'string': str, 
5502                  'text': str, 
5503                  'date': datetime.date, 
5504                  'datetime': datetime.datetime, 
5505                  'id': long, 
5506                  'boolean': bool, 
5507                  'integer': int, 
5508                  'bigint': long, 
5509                  'blob': str, 
5510                  'list:string': str, 
5511          } 
5512   
5513      dbengine = 'imap' 
5514   
5515      REGEX_URI = re.compile('^(?P<user>[^:]+)(\:(?P<password>[^@]*))?@(?P<host>[^\:@]+)(\:(?P<port>[0-9]+))?$') 
5516   

5517 -    def __init__(self, 
5518                   db, 
5519                   uri, 
5520                   pool_size=0, 
5521                   folder=None, 
5522                   db_codec ='UTF-8', 
5523                   credential_decoder=IDENTITY, 
5524                   driver_args={}, 
5525                   adapter_args={}): 

5526   
5527          # db uri: user@example.com:password@imap.server.com:123 
5528          # TODO: max size adapter argument for preventing large mail transfers 
5529   
5530          self.db = db 
5531          self.uri = uri 
5532          self.find_driver(adapter_args) 
5533          self.pool_size=pool_size 
5534          self.folder = folder 
5535          self.db_codec = db_codec 
5536          self.credential_decoder = credential_decoder 
5537          self.driver_args = driver_args 
5538          self.adapter_args = adapter_args 
5539          self.mailbox_size = None 
5540          self.charset = sys.getfilesystemencoding() 
5541          # imap class 
5542          self.imap4 = None 
5543          uri = uri.split("://")[1] 
5544   
5545          """ MESSAGE is an identifier for sequence number""" 
5546   
5547          self.flags = ['\\Deleted', '\\Draft', '\\Flagged', 
5548                        '\\Recent', '\\Seen', '\\Answered'] 
5549          self.search_fields = { 
5550              'id': 'MESSAGE', 'created': 'DATE', 
5551              'uid': 'UID', 'sender': 'FROM', 
5552              'to': 'TO', 'cc': 'CC', 
5553              'bcc': 'BCC', 'content': 'TEXT', 
5554              'size': 'SIZE', 'deleted': '\\Deleted', 
5555              'draft': '\\Draft', 'flagged': '\\Flagged', 
5556              'recent': '\\Recent', 'seen': '\\Seen', 
5557              'subject': 'SUBJECT', 'answered': '\\Answered', 
5558              'mime': None, 'email': None, 
5559              'attachments': None 
5560              } 
5561   
5562          db['_lastsql'] = '' 
5563   
5564          m = self.REGEX_URI.match(uri) 
5565          user = m.group('user') 
5566          password = m.group('password') 
5567          host = m.group('host') 
5568          port = int(m.group('port')) 
5569          over_ssl = False 
5570          if port==993: 
5571              over_ssl = True 
5572   
5573          driver_args.update(host=host,port=port, password=password, user=user) 
5574          def connect(driver_args=driver_args): 
5575              # it is assumed sucessful authentication alLways 
5576              # TODO: support direct connection and login tests 
5577              if over_ssl: 
5578                  self.imap4 = self.driver.IMAP4_SSL 
5579              else: 
5580                  self.imap4 = self.driver.IMAP4 
5581              connection = self.imap4(driver_args["host"], driver_args["port"]) 
5582              data = connection.login(driver_args["user"], driver_args["password"]) 
5583   
5584              # static mailbox list 
5585              connection.mailbox_names = None 
5586   
5587              # dummy cursor function 
5588              connection.cursor = lambda : True

5596 -    def pool_connection(self, f, cursor=True): 

5597          """ 
5598          IMAP4 Pool connection method 
5599   
5600          imap connection lacks of self cursor command. 
5601          A custom command should be provided as a replacement 
5602          for connection pooling to prevent uncaught remote session 
5603          closing 
5604   
5605          """ 
5606          pools = ConnectionPool.pools 
5607          if not self.pool_size: 
5608              self.connection = f() 
5609              self.cursor = cursor and self.connection.cursor() 
5610          else: 
5611              uri = self.uri 
5612              while True: 
5613                  sql_locker.acquire() 
5614                  if not uri in pools: 
5615                      pools[uri] = [] 
5616                  if pools[uri]: 
5617                      self.connection = pools[uri].pop() 
5618                      sql_locker.release() 
5619                      self.cursor = cursor and self.connection.cursor() 
5620                      if self.cursor and self.check_active_connection: 
5621                          try: 
5622                              # check if connection is alive or close it 
5623                              result, data = self.connection.list() 
5624                          except: 
5625                              # Possible connection reset error 
5626                              # TODO: read exception class 
5627                              self.connection = f() 
5628                      break 
5629                  else: 
5630                      sql_locker.release() 
5631                      self.connection = f() 
5632                      self.cursor = cursor and self.connection.cursor() 
5633                      break 
5634   
5635          if not hasattr(thread,'instances'): 
5636              thread.instances = [] 
5637          thread.instances.append(self) 

5638

5648          except (IndexError, ValueError, TypeError, KeyError), e: 
5649              logger.debug("Error retrieving the last mailbox sequence number. %s" % str(e))

5665 -    def convert_date(self, date, add=None): 

5666          if add is None: 
5667              add = datetime.timedelta() 
5668          """ Convert a date object to a string 
5669          with d-Mon-Y style for IMAP or the inverse 
5670          case 
5671   
5672          add <timedelta> adds to the date object 
5673          """ 
5674          months = [None, "Jan","Feb","Mar","Apr","May","Jun", 
5675                    "Jul", "Aug","Sep","Oct","Nov","Dec"] 
5676          if isinstance(date, basestring): 
5677              # Prevent unexpected date response format 
5678              try: 
5679                  dayname, datestring = date.split(",") 
5680              except (ValueError): 
5681                  logger.debug("Could not parse date text: %s" % date) 
5682                  return None 
5683              date_list = datestring.strip().split() 
5684              year = int(date_list[2]) 
5685              month = months.index(date_list[1]) 
5686              day = int(date_list[0]) 
5687              hms = [int(value) for value in date_list[3].split(":")] 
5688              return datetime.datetime(year, month, day, 
5689                                       hms[0], hms[1], hms[2]) + add 
5690          elif isinstance(date, (datetime.datetime, datetime.date)): 
5691              return (date + add).strftime("%d-%b-%Y") 
5692   
5693          else: 
5694              return None 

5695   

5696 -    def encode_text(self, text, charset, errors="replace"): 

5697          """ convert text for mail to unicode""" 
5698          if text is None: 
5699              text = "" 
5700          else: 
5701              if isinstance(text, str): 
5702                  if charset is not None: 
5703                      text = unicode(text, charset, errors) 
5704                  else: 
5705                      text = unicode(text, "utf-8", errors) 
5706              else: 
5707                  raise Exception("Unsupported mail text type %s" % type(text)) 
5708          return text.encode("utf-8") 

5709

5718 -    def get_mailboxes(self): 

5719          """ Query the mail database for mailbox names """ 
5720          mailboxes_list = self.connection.list() 
5721          self.connection.mailbox_names = dict() 
5722          mailboxes = list() 
5723          x = 0 
5724          for item in mailboxes_list[1]: 
5725              x = x + 1 
5726              item = item.strip() 
5727              if not "NOSELECT" in item.upper(): 
5728                  sub_items = item.split("\"") 
5729                  sub_items = [sub_item for sub_item in sub_items \ 
5730                  if len(sub_item.strip()) > 0] 
5731                  mailbox = sub_items[len(sub_items) - 1] 
5732                  # remove unwanted characters and store original names 
5733                  # Don't allow leading non alphabetic characters 
5734                  mailbox_name = re.sub('^[_0-9]*', '', re.sub('[^_\w]','',re.sub('[/ ]','_',mailbox))) 
5735                  mailboxes.append(mailbox_name) 
5736                  self.connection.mailbox_names[mailbox_name] = mailbox 
5737   
5738          return mailboxes

5749                  elif isinstance(attr, Query): 
5750                      pass 
5751                  else: 
5752                      return None 
5753              else:

5763 -    def define_tables(self): 

5764          """ 
5765          Auto create common IMAP fileds 
5766   
5767          This function creates fields definitions "statically" 
5768          meaning that custom fields as in other adapters should 
5769          not be supported and definitions handled on a service/mode 
5770          basis (local syntax for Gmail(r), Ymail(r) 
5771   
5772          Returns a dictionary with tablename, server native mailbox name 
5773          pairs. 
5774          """ 
5775          if not isinstance(self.connection.mailbox_names, dict): 
5776              self.get_mailboxes() 
5777          mailboxes = self.connection.mailbox_names.keys() 
5778          for mailbox_name in mailboxes: 
5779              self.db.define_table("%s" % mailbox_name, 
5780                              Field("uid", "string", writable=False), 
5781                              Field("answered", "boolean"), 
5782                              Field("created", "datetime", writable=False), 
5783                              Field("content", "list:string", writable=False), 
5784                              Field("to", "string", writable=False), 
5785                              Field("cc", "string", writable=False), 
5786                              Field("bcc", "string", writable=False), 
5787                              Field("size", "integer", writable=False), 
5788                              Field("deleted", "boolean"), 
5789                              Field("draft", "boolean"), 
5790                              Field("flagged", "boolean"), 
5791                              Field("sender", "string", writable=False), 
5792                              Field("recent", "boolean", writable=False), 
5793                              Field("seen", "boolean"), 
5794                              Field("subject", "string", writable=False), 
5795                              Field("mime", "string", writable=False), 
5796                              Field("email", "string", writable=False, readable=False), 
5797                              Field("attachments", "list:string", writable=False, readable=False), 
5798                              )

6122          if name == "MESSAGE": 
6123              last_message = self.get_last_message(first.tablename) 
6124              result = "%d:%d" % (int(self.expand(second)) + 1, last_message) 
6125          elif name == "UID": 
6126              # GT and LT may not return 
6127              # expected sets depending on 
6128              # the uid format implemented 
6129              try: 
6130                  pedestal, threshold = self.get_uid_bounds(first.tablename) 
6131              except TypeError, e: 
6132                  logger.debug("Error requesting uid bounds: %s", str(e)) 
6133                  return "" 
6134              try: 
6135                  lower_limit = int(self.expand(second)) + 1 
6136              except (ValueError, TypeError), e: 
6137                  raise Exception("Operation not supported (non integer UID)") 
6138              result = "UID %s:%s" % (lower_limit, threshold) 
6139          elif name == "DATE": 
6140              result = "SINCE %s" % self.convert_date(second, add=datetime.timedelta(1)) 
6141          elif name == "SIZE": 
6142              result = "LARGER %s" % self.expand(second) 
6143          else: 
6144              raise Exception("Operation not supported") 
6145          return result 

6146   

6147 -    def GE(self, first, second):

6153          elif name == "UID": 
6154              # GT and LT may not return 
6155              # expected sets depending on 
6156              # the uid format implemented 
6157              try: 
6158                  pedestal, threshold = self.get_uid_bounds(first.tablename)

6160                  logger.debug("Error requesting uid bounds: %s", str(e))

6164          elif name == "DATE": 
6165              result = "SINCE %s" % self.convert_date(second)

6293 -def sqlhtml_validators(field): 

6294      """ 
6295      Field type validation, using web2py's validators mechanism. 
6296   
6297      makes sure the content of a field is in line with the declared 
6298      fieldtype 
6299      """ 
6300      db = field.db 
6301      if not have_validators: 
6302          return [] 
6303      field_type, field_length = field.type, field.length 
6304      if isinstance(field_type, SQLCustomType): 
6305          if hasattr(field_type, 'validator'): 
6306              return field_type.validator 
6307          else: 
6308              field_type = field_type.type 
6309      elif not isinstance(field_type,str): 
6310          return [] 
6311      requires=[] 
6312      def ff(r,id): 
6313          row=r(id) 
6314          if not row: 
6315              return id 
6316          elif hasattr(r, '_format') and isinstance(r._format,str): 
6317              return r._format % row 
6318          elif hasattr(r, '_format') and callable(r._format): 
6319              return r._format(row) 
6320          else: 
6321              return id 

6322      if field_type == 'string': 
6323          requires.append(validators.IS_LENGTH(field_length)) 
6324      elif field_type == 'text': 
6325          requires.append(validators.IS_LENGTH(field_length)) 
6326      elif field_type == 'password': 
6327          requires.append(validators.IS_LENGTH(field_length)) 
6328      elif field_type == 'double' or field_type == 'float': 
6329          requires.append(validators.IS_FLOAT_IN_RANGE(-1e100, 1e100)) 
6330      elif field_type in ('integer','bigint'): 
6331          requires.append(validators.IS_INT_IN_RANGE(-1e100, 1e100)) 
6332      elif field_type.startswith('decimal'): 
6333          requires.append(validators.IS_DECIMAL_IN_RANGE(-10**10, 10**10)) 
6334      elif field_type == 'date': 
6335          requires.append(validators.IS_DATE()) 
6336      elif field_type == 'time': 
6337          requires.append(validators.IS_TIME()) 
6338      elif field_type == 'datetime': 
6339          requires.append(validators.IS_DATETIME()) 
6340      elif db and field_type.startswith('reference') and \ 
6341              field_type.find('.') < 0 and \ 
6342              field_type[10:] in db.tables: 
6343          referenced = db[field_type[10:]] 
6344          def repr_ref(id, row=None, r=referenced, f=ff): return f(r, id) 
6345          field.represent = field.represent or repr_ref 
6346          if hasattr(referenced, '_format') and referenced._format: 
6347              requires = validators.IS_IN_DB(db,referenced._id, 
6348                                             referenced._format) 
6349              if field.unique: 
6350                  requires._and = validators.IS_NOT_IN_DB(db,field) 
6351              if field.tablename == field_type[10:]: 
6352                  return validators.IS_EMPTY_OR(requires) 
6353              return requires 
6354      elif db and field_type.startswith('list:reference') and \ 
6355              field_type.find('.') < 0 and \ 
6356              field_type[15:] in db.tables: 
6357          referenced = db[field_type[15:]] 
6358          def list_ref_repr(ids, row=None, r=referenced, f=ff): 
6359              if not ids: 
6360                  return None 
6361              refs = None 
6362              db, id = r._db, r._id 
6363              if isinstance(db._adapter, GoogleDatastoreAdapter): 
6364                  for i in xrange(0, len(ids), 30): 
6365                      if not refs: 
6366                          refs = db(id.belongs(ids[i:i+30])).select(id) 
6367                      else: 
6368                          refs = refs&db(id.belongs(ids[i:i+30])).select(id) 
6369              else: 
6370                  refs = db(id.belongs(ids)).select(id) 
6371              return (refs and ', '.join(str(f(r,x.id)) for x in refs) or '') 
6372          field.represent = field.represent or list_ref_repr 
6373          if hasattr(referenced, '_format') and referenced._format: 
6374              requires = validators.IS_IN_DB(db,referenced._id, 
6375                                             referenced._format,multiple=True) 
6376          else: 
6377              requires = validators.IS_IN_DB(db,referenced._id, 
6378                                             multiple=True) 
6379          if field.unique: 
6380              requires._and = validators.IS_NOT_IN_DB(db,field) 
6381          return requires 
6382      elif field_type.startswith('list:'): 
6383          def repr_list(values,row=None): return', '.join(str(v) for v in (values or [])) 
6384          field.represent = field.represent or repr_list 
6385      if field.unique: 
6386          requires.insert(0,validators.IS_NOT_IN_DB(db,field)) 
6387      sff = ['in', 'do', 'da', 'ti', 'de', 'bo'] 
6388      if field.notnull and not field_type[:2] in sff: 
6389          requires.insert(0, validators.IS_NOT_EMPTY()) 
6390      elif not field.notnull and field_type[:2] in sff and requires: 
6391          requires[-1] = validators.IS_EMPTY_OR(requires[-1]) 
6392      return requires

6529 -def smart_query(fields,text): 

6530      if not isinstance(fields,(list,tuple)): 
6531          fields = [fields] 
6532      new_fields = [] 
6533      for field in fields: 
6534          if isinstance(field,Field): 
6535              new_fields.append(field) 
6536          elif isinstance(field,Table): 
6537              for ofield in field: 
6538                  new_fields.append(ofield) 
6539          else: 
6540              raise RuntimeError, "fields must be a list of fields" 
6541      fields = new_fields 
6542      field_map = {} 
6543      for field in fields: 
6544          n = field.name.lower() 
6545          if not n in field_map: 
6546              field_map[n] = field 
6547          n = str(field).lower() 
6548          if not n in field_map: 
6549              field_map[n] = field 
6550      constants = {}

6553          m = REGEX_CONST_STRING.search(text) 
6554          if not m: break 
6555          text = text[:m.start()]+('#%i' % i)+text[m.end():] 
6556          constants[str(i)] = m.group()[1:-1] 
6557          i+=1 
6558      text = re.sub('\s+',' ',text).lower() 
6559      for a,b in [('&','and'), 
6560                  ('|','or'), 
6561                  ('~','not'), 
6562                  ('==','='), 
6563                  ('<','<'), 
6564                  ('>','>'), 
6565                  ('<=','<='), 
6566                  ('>=','>='),

6568                  ('=<','<='), 
6569                  ('=>','>='), 
6570                  ('=','='), 
6571                  (' less or equal than ','<='), 
6572                  (' greater or equal than ','>='), 
6573                  (' equal or less than ','<='), 
6574                  (' equal or greater than ','>='), 
6575                  (' less or equal ','<='), 
6576                  (' greater or equal ','>='), 
6577                  (' equal or less ','<='),

6580                  (' not equal ','!='), 
6581                  (' equal to ','='), 
6582                  (' equal ','='), 
6583                  (' equals ','!='),

6585                  (' greater than ','>'), 
6586                  (' starts with ','startswith'), 
6587                  (' ends with ','endswith'), 
6588                  (' is ','=')]:

6591          text = text.replace(a,' %s ' % b) 
6592      text = re.sub('\s+',' ',text).lower() 
6593      text = re.sub('(?P<a>[\<\>\!\=])\s+(?P<b>[\<\>\!\=])','\g<a>\g<b>',text)

6595      for item in text.split(): 
6596          if field is None: 
6597              if item == 'not': 
6598                  neg = True 
6599              elif not neg and not logic and item in ('and','or'): 
6600                  logic = item 
6601              elif item in field_map: 
6602                  field = field_map[item] 
6603              else: 
6604                  raise RuntimeError, "Invalid syntax" 
6605          elif not field is None and op is None: 
6606              op = item 
6607          elif not op is None: 
6608              if item.startswith('#'): 
6609                  if not item[1:] in constants: 
6610                      raise RuntimeError, "Invalid syntax" 
6611                  value = constants[item[1:]] 
6612              else: 
6613                  value = item 
6614                  if field.type in ('text','string'): 
6615                      if op == '=': op = 'like' 
6616              if op == '=': new_query = field==value 
6617              elif op == '<': new_query = field<value 
6618              elif op == '>': new_query = field>value 
6619              elif op == '<=': new_query = field<=value 
6620              elif op == '>=': new_query = field>=value 
6621              elif op == '!=': new_query = field!=value 
6622              elif field.type in ('text','string'): 
6623                  if op == 'contains': new_query = field.contains(value) 
6624                  elif op == 'like': new_query = field.like(value) 
6625                  elif op == 'startswith': new_query = field.startswith(value) 
6626                  elif op == 'endswith': new_query = field.endswith(value) 
6627                  else: raise RuntimeError, "Invalid operation" 
6628              else: raise RuntimeError, "Invalid operation" 
6629              if neg: new_query = ~new_query 
6630              if query is None: 
6631                  query = new_query 
6632              elif logic == 'and': 
6633                  query &= new_query 
6634              elif logic == 'or': 
6635                  query |= new_query 
6636              field = op = neg = logic = None 
6637      return query

6703                   decode_credentials=False, driver_args=None, 
6704                   adapter_args=None, attempts=5, auto_import=False, 
6705                   bigint_id=False,debug=False,lazy_tables=False): 

6706          """ 
6707          Creates a new Database Abstraction Layer instance. 
6708   
6709          Keyword arguments: 
6710   
6711          :uri: string that contains information for connecting to a database. 
6712                 (default: 'sqlite://dummy.db') 
6713          :pool_size: How many open connections to make to the database object. 
6714          :folder: <please update me> 
6715          :db_codec: string encoding of the database (default: 'UTF-8') 
6716          :check_reserved: list of adapters to check tablenames and column names 
6717                           against sql reserved keywords. (Default None) 
6718   
6719          * 'common' List of sql keywords that are common to all database types 
6720                  such as "SELECT, INSERT". (recommended) 
6721          * 'all' Checks against all known SQL keywords. (not recommended) 
6722                  <adaptername> Checks against the specific adapters list of keywords 
6723                  (recommended) 
6724          * '<adaptername>_nonreserved' Checks against the specific adapters 
6725                  list of nonreserved keywords. (if available) 
6726          :migrate (defaults to True) sets default migrate behavior for all tables 
6727          :fake_migrate (defaults to False) sets default fake_migrate behavior for all tables 
6728          :migrate_enabled (defaults to True). If set to False disables ALL migrations 
6729          :fake_migrate_all (defaults to False). If sets to True fake migrates ALL tables 
6730          :attempts (defaults to 5). Number of times to attempt connecting 
6731          """ 
6732          if not decode_credentials: 
6733              credential_decoder = lambda cred: cred 
6734          else: 
6735              credential_decoder = lambda cred: urllib.unquote(cred) 
6736          if folder: 
6737              self.set_folder(folder) 
6738          self._uri = uri 
6739          self._pool_size = pool_size 
6740          self._db_codec = db_codec 
6741          self._lastsql = '' 
6742          self._timings = [] 
6743          self._pending_references = {} 
6744          self._request_tenant = 'request_tenant' 
6745          self._common_fields = [] 
6746          self._referee_name = '%(table)s' 
6747          self._bigint_id = bigint_id 
6748          self._debug = debug 
6749          self._migrated = [] 
6750          self._LAZY_TABLES = {} 
6751          self._lazy_tables = lazy_tables 
6752          if not str(attempts).isdigit() or attempts < 0: 
6753              attempts = 5 
6754          if uri: 
6755              uris = isinstance(uri,(list,tuple)) and uri or [uri] 
6756              error = '' 
6757              connected = False 
6758              for k in range(attempts): 
6759                  for uri in uris: 
6760                      try: 
6761                          if is_jdbc and not uri.startswith('jdbc:'): 
6762                              uri = 'jdbc:'+uri 
6763                          self._dbname = REGEX_DBNAME.match(uri).group() 
6764                          if not self._dbname in ADAPTERS: 
6765                              raise SyntaxError, "Error in URI '%s' or database not supported" % self._dbname 
6766                          # notice that driver args or {} else driver_args 
6767                          # defaults to {} global, not correct 
6768                          args = (self,uri,pool_size,folder, 
6769                                  db_codec, credential_decoder, 
6770                                  driver_args or {}, adapter_args or {}) 
6771                          self._adapter = ADAPTERS[self._dbname](*args) 
6772                          if bigint_id: 
6773                              types = ADAPTERS[self._dbname].types 
6774                              self._adapter.types = copy.copy(types) # copy so multiple DAL() possible 
6775                              if 'big-id' in types and 'reference' in types: 
6776                                  self._adapter.types['id'] = types['big-id'] 
6777                                  self._adapter.types['reference'] = types['big-reference'] 
6778                          connected = True 
6779                          break 
6780                      except SyntaxError: 
6781                          raise 
6782                      except Exception, error: 
6783                          tb = traceback.format_exc() 
6784                          sys.stderr.write('DEBUG: connect attempt %i, connection error:\n%s' % (k, tb)) 
6785                  if connected: 
6786                      break 
6787                  else: 
6788                      time.sleep(1) 
6789              if not connected: 
6790                  raise RuntimeError, "Failure to connect, tried %d times:\n%s" % (attempts, tb) 
6791          else: 
6792              args = (self,'None',0,folder,db_codec) 
6793              self._adapter = BaseAdapter(*args) 
6794              migrate = fake_migrate = False 
6795          adapter = self._adapter 
6796          self._uri_hash = hashlib.md5(adapter.uri).hexdigest() 
6797          self._tables = SQLCallableList() 
6798          self.check_reserved = check_reserved 
6799          if self.check_reserved: 
6800              from reserved_sql_keywords import ADAPTERS as RSK 
6801              self.RSK = RSK 
6802          self._migrate = migrate 
6803          self._fake_migrate = fake_migrate 
6804          self._migrate_enabled = migrate_enabled 
6805          self._fake_migrate_all = fake_migrate_all 
6806          if auto_import: 
6807              self.import_table_definitions(adapter.folder) 

6808   
6809      @property 

6810 -    def tables(self): 

6811          return self._tables

6813 -    def import_table_definitions(self,path,migrate=False,fake_migrate=False): 

6814          pattern = pjoin(path,self._uri_hash+'_*.table') 
6815          for filename in glob.glob(pattern): 
6816              tfile = self._adapter.file_open(filename, 'r') 
6817              try: 
6818                  sql_fields = cPickle.load(tfile) 
6819                  name = filename[len(pattern)-7:-6] 
6820                  mf = [(value['sortable'],Field(key,type=value['type'])) \ 
6821                            for key, value in sql_fields.iteritems()] 
6822                  mf.sort(lambda a,b: cmp(a[0],b[0])) 
6823                  self.define_table(name,*[item[1] for item in mf], 
6824                                    **dict(migrate=migrate,fake_migrate=fake_migrate)) 
6825              finally: 
6826                  self._adapter.file_close(tfile)

6828 -    def check_reserved_keyword(self, name): 

6829          """ 
6830          Validates ``name`` against SQL keywords 
6831          Uses self.check_reserve which is a list of 
6832          operators to use. 
6833          self.check_reserved 
6834          ['common', 'postgres', 'mysql'] 
6835          self.check_reserved 
6836          ['all'] 
6837          """ 
6838          for backend in self.check_reserved: 
6839              if name.upper() in self.RSK[backend]: 
6840                  raise SyntaxError, 'invalid table/column name "%s" is a "%s" reserved SQL keyword' % (name, backend.upper())

6844          EXAMPLE:

6847  db.define_table('pet',Field('owner',db.person),Field('name'),Field('info')) 
6848   
6849  @request.restful() 
6850  def index(): 
6851      def GET(*args,**vars): 
6852          patterns = [ 
6853              "/friends[person]", 
6854              "/{friend.name.startswith}", 
6855              "/{friend.name}/:field", 
6856              "/{friend.name}/pets[pet.owner]", 
6857              "/{friend.name}/pet[pet.owner]/{pet.name}", 
6858              "/{friend.name}/pet[pet.owner]/{pet.name}/:field"

6861          if parser.status == 200: 
6862              return dict(content=parser.response) 
6863          else: 
6864              raise HTTP(parser.status,parser.error)

6876          re1 = REGEX_SEARCH_PATTERN 
6877          re2 = REGEX_SQUARE_BRACKETS 
6878   
6879          def auto_table(table,base='',depth=0): 
6880              patterns = [] 
6881              for field in db[table].fields: 
6882                  if base: 
6883                      tag = '%s/%s' % (base,field.replace('_','-')) 
6884                  else: 
6885                      tag = '/%s/%s' % (table.replace('_','-'),field.replace('_','-')) 
6886                  f = db[table][field] 
6887                  if not f.readable: continue 
6888                  if f.type=='id' or 'slug' in field or f.type.startswith('reference'): 
6889                      tag += '/{%s.%s}' % (table,field) 
6890                      patterns.append(tag) 
6891                      patterns.append(tag+'/:field') 
6892                  elif f.type.startswith('boolean'): 
6893                      tag += '/{%s.%s}' % (table,field) 
6894                      patterns.append(tag) 
6895                      patterns.append(tag+'/:field') 
6896                  elif f.type in ('float','double','integer','bigint'): 
6897                      tag += '/{%s.%s.ge}/{%s.%s.lt}' % (table,field,table,field) 
6898                      patterns.append(tag) 
6899                      patterns.append(tag+'/:field') 
6900                  elif f.type.startswith('list:'): 
6901                      tag += '/{%s.%s.contains}' % (table,field) 
6902                      patterns.append(tag) 
6903                      patterns.append(tag+'/:field') 
6904                  elif f.type in ('date','datetime'): 
6905                      tag+= '/{%s.%s.year}' % (table,field) 
6906                      patterns.append(tag) 
6907                      patterns.append(tag+'/:field') 
6908                      tag+='/{%s.%s.month}' % (table,field) 
6909                      patterns.append(tag) 
6910                      patterns.append(tag+'/:field') 
6911                      tag+='/{%s.%s.day}' % (table,field) 
6912                      patterns.append(tag) 
6913                      patterns.append(tag+'/:field') 
6914                  if f.type in ('datetime','time'): 
6915                      tag+= '/{%s.%s.hour}' % (table,field) 
6916                      patterns.append(tag) 
6917                      patterns.append(tag+'/:field') 
6918                      tag+='/{%s.%s.minute}' % (table,field) 
6919                      patterns.append(tag) 
6920                      patterns.append(tag+'/:field') 
6921                      tag+='/{%s.%s.second}' % (table,field) 
6922                      patterns.append(tag) 
6923                      patterns.append(tag+'/:field') 
6924                  if depth>0: 
6925                      for f in db[table]._referenced_by: 
6926                          tag+='/%s[%s.%s]' % (rtable,f.tablename,f.name) 
6927                          patterns.append(tag) 
6928                          patterns += auto_table(rtable,base=tag,depth=depth-1) 
6929              return patterns 

6930   
6931          if patterns==DEFAULT: 
6932              patterns=[] 
6933              for table in db.tables: 
6934                  if not table.startswith('auth_'): 
6935                      patterns.append('/%s[%s]' % (table,table)) 
6936                      patterns += auto_table(table,base='',depth=1) 
6937          else: 
6938              i = 0 
6939              while i<len(patterns): 
6940                  pattern = patterns[i] 
6941                  tokens = pattern.split('/') 
6942                  if tokens[-1].startswith(':auto') and re2.match(tokens[-1]): 
6943                      new_patterns = auto_table(tokens[-1][tokens[-1].find('[')+1:-1], 
6944                                                '/'.join(tokens[:-1])) 
6945                      patterns = patterns[:i]+new_patterns+patterns[i+1:] 
6946                      i += len(new_patterns) 
6947                  else: 
6948                      i += 1 
6949          if '/'.join(args) == 'patterns': 
6950              return Row({'status':200,'pattern':'list', 
6951                          'error':None,'response':patterns})

6963                      tokens = tag[1:-1].split('.') 
6964                      table, field = tokens[0], tokens[1] 
6965                      if not otable or table == otable: 
6966                          if len(tokens)==2 or tokens[2]=='eq': 
6967                              query = db[table][field]==args[i] 
6968                          elif tokens[2]=='ne': 
6969                              query = db[table][field]!=args[i] 
6970                          elif tokens[2]=='lt': 
6971                              query = db[table][field]<args[i] 
6972                          elif tokens[2]=='gt': 
6973                              query = db[table][field]>args[i] 
6974                          elif tokens[2]=='ge': 
6975                              query = db[table][field]>=args[i] 
6976                          elif tokens[2]=='le': 
6977                              query = db[table][field]<=args[i] 
6978                          elif tokens[2]=='year': 
6979                              query = db[table][field].year()==args[i] 
6980                          elif tokens[2]=='month': 
6981                              query = db[table][field].month()==args[i] 
6982                          elif tokens[2]=='day': 
6983                              query = db[table][field].day()==args[i] 
6984                          elif tokens[2]=='hour': 
6985                              query = db[table][field].hour()==args[i] 
6986                          elif tokens[2]=='minute': 
6987                              query = db[table][field].minutes()==args[i] 
6988                          elif tokens[2]=='second': 
6989                              query = db[table][field].seconds()==args[i] 
6990                          elif tokens[2]=='startswith': 
6991                              query = db[table][field].startswith(args[i]) 
6992                          elif tokens[2]=='contains': 
6993                              query = db[table][field].contains(args[i]) 
6994                          else: 
6995                              raise RuntimeError, "invalid pattern: %s" % pattern 
6996                          if len(tokens)==4 and tokens[3]=='not': 
6997                              query = ~query 
6998                          elif len(tokens)>=4: 
6999                              raise RuntimeError, "invalid pattern: %s" % pattern 
7000                          if not otable and isinstance(queries,dict): 
7001                              dbset = db(queries[table]) 
7002                          dbset=dbset(query) 
7003                      else: 
7004                          raise RuntimeError, "missing relation in pattern: %s" % pattern 
7005                  elif re2.match(tag) and args[i]==tag[:tag.find('[')]: 
7006                      ref = tag[tag.find('[')+1:-1] 
7007                      if '.' in ref and otable: 
7008                          table,field = ref.split('.')

7011                              try:

7019                      else:

7022                              dbset = db(queries[table]) 
7023                          dbset=dbset(db[table]) 
7024                  elif tag==':field' and table: 
7025                      # # print 're3:'+tag 
7026                      field = args[i] 
7027                      if not field in db[table]: break 
7028                      # hand-built patterns should respect .readable=False as well 
7029                      if not db[table][field].readable: 
7030                          return Row({'status':418,'pattern':pattern, 
7031                                      'error':'I\'m a teapot','response':None}) 
7032                      try: 
7033                          item =  dbset.select(db[table][field],limitby=(0,1)).first() 
7034                      except ValueError: 
7035                          return Row({'status':400,'pattern':pattern, 
7036                                      'error':'invalid path','response':None}) 
7037                      if not item: 
7038                          return Row({'status':404,'pattern':pattern, 
7039                                      'error':'record not found','response':None}) 
7040                      else: 
7041                          return Row({'status':200,'response':item[field], 
7042                                      'pattern':pattern}) 
7043                  elif tag != args[i]: 
7044                      break 
7045                  otable = table 
7046                  i += 1 
7047                  if i==len(tags) and table: 
7048                      ofields = vars.get('order',db[table]._id.name).split('|') 
7049                      try: 
7050                          orderby = [db[table][f] if not f.startswith('~') else ~db[table][f[1:]] for f in ofields] 
7051                      except (KeyError, AttributeError): 
7052                          return Row({'status':400,'error':'invalid orderby','response':None}) 
7053                      fields = [field for field in db[table] if field.readable] 
7054                      count = dbset.count() 
7055                      try: 
7056                          offset = int(vars.get('offset',None) or 0) 
7057                          limits = (offset,int(vars.get('limit',None) or 1000)+offset) 
7058                      except ValueError: 
7059                          Row({'status':400,'error':'invalid limits','response':None}) 
7060                      if count > limits[1]-limits[0]: 
7061                          Row({'status':400,'error':'too many records','response':None}) 
7062                      try: 
7063                          response = dbset.select(limitby=limits,orderby=orderby,*fields) 
7064                      except ValueError: 
7065                          return Row({'status':400,'pattern':pattern, 
7066                                      'error':'invalid path','response':None}) 
7067                      return Row({'status':200,'response':response, 
7068                                  'pattern':pattern,'count':count}) 
7069          return Row({'status':400,'error':'no matching pattern','response':None})

7071 -    def define_table( 
7072          self, 
7073          tablename, 
7074          *fields, 
7075          **args 
7076          ): 

7077          if not isinstance(tablename,str): 
7078              raise SyntaxError, "missing table name" 
7079          elif tablename.startswith('_') or hasattr(self,tablename) or \ 
7080                  REGEX_PYTHON_KEYWORDS.match(tablename): 
7081              raise SyntaxError, 'invalid table name: %s' % tablename 
7082          elif tablename in self.tables: 
7083              raise SyntaxError, 'table already defined: %s' % tablename 
7084          elif self.check_reserved: 
7085              self.check_reserved_keyword(tablename) 
7086          else: 
7087              invalid_args = set(args)-TABLE_ARGS 
7088              if invalid_args: 
7089                  raise SyntaxError, 'invalid table "%s" attributes: %s' \ 
7090                      % (tablename,invalid_args) 
7091          if self._lazy_tables and not tablename in self._LAZY_TABLES: 
7092              self._LAZY_TABLES[tablename] = (tablename,fields,args) 
7093              table = None 
7094          else: 
7095              table = self.lazy_define_table(tablename,*fields,**args) 
7096          self.tables.append(tablename) 
7097          return table

7099 -    def lazy_define_table( 
7100          self, 
7101          tablename, 
7102          *fields, 
7103          **args 
7104          ): 

7105          args_get = args.get 
7106          common_fields = self._common_fields 
7107          if common_fields: 
7108              fields = list(fields) + list(common_fields) 
7109   
7110          table_class = args_get('table_class',Table) 
7111          table = table_class(self, tablename, *fields, **args) 
7112          table._actual = True 
7113          self[tablename] = table 
7114          table._create_references() # must follow above line to handle self references 
7115

7117          if migrate and not self._uri in (None,'None') \ 
7118                  or self._adapter.dbengine=='google:datastore': 
7119              fake_migrate = self._fake_migrate_all or \ 
7120                  args_get('fake_migrate',self._fake_migrate)

7122              try: 
7123                  sql_locker.acquire() 
7124                  self._adapter.create_table(table,migrate=migrate, 
7125                                             fake_migrate=fake_migrate, 
7126                                             polymodel=polymodel) 
7127              finally: 
7128                  sql_locker.release() 
7129          else: 
7130              table._dbt = None 
7131          on_define = args_get('on_define',None) 
7132          if on_define: on_define(table) 
7133          return table

7174              query = query._id>0 
7175          elif isinstance(query,Field): 
7176              query = query!=None 
7177          return Set(self, query, ignore_common_filters=ignore_common_filters)

7186          adapter = self._adapter 
7187          if adapter in thread.instances: 
7188              thread.instances.remove(adapter) 
7189          adapter.close()

7191 -    def executesql(self, query, placeholders=None, as_dict=False, 
7192                     fields=None, colnames=None): 

7193          """ 
7194          placeholders is optional and will always be None. 
7195          If using raw SQL with placeholders, placeholders may be 
7196          a sequence of values to be substituted in 
7197          or, (if supported by the DB driver), a dictionary with keys 
7198          matching named placeholders in your SQL. 
7199   
7200          Added 2009-12-05 "as_dict" optional argument. Will always be 
7201          None when using DAL. If using raw SQL can be set to True 
7202          and the results cursor returned by the DB driver will be 
7203          converted to a sequence of dictionaries keyed with the db 
7204          field names. Tested with SQLite but should work with any database 
7205          since the cursor.description used to get field names is part of the 
7206          Python dbi 2.0 specs. Results returned with as_dict=True are 
7207          the same as those returned when applying .to_list() to a DAL query. 
7208   
7209          [{field1: value1, field2: value2}, {field1: value1b, field2: value2b}] 
7210   
7211          Added 2012-08-24 "fields" and "colnames" optional arguments. If either 
7212          is provided, the results cursor returned by the DB driver will be 
7213          converted to a DAL Rows object using the db._adapter.parse() method. 
7214           
7215          The "fields" argument is a list of DAL Field objects that match the 
7216          fields returned from the DB. The Field objects should be part of one or 
7217          more Table objects defined on the DAL object. The "fields" list can 
7218          include one or more DAL Table objects in addition to or instead of 
7219          including Field objects, or it can be just a single table (not in a 
7220          list). In that case, the Field objects will be extracted from the 
7221          table(s). 
7222   
7223          Instead of specifying the "fields" argument, the "colnames" argument 
7224          can be specified as a list of field names in tablename.fieldname format. 
7225          Again, these should represent tables and fields defined on the DAL 
7226          object. 
7227           
7228          It is also possible to specify both "fields" and the associated 
7229          "colnames". In that case, "fields" can also include DAL Expression 
7230          objects in addition to Field objects. For Field objects in "fields", 
7231          the associated "colnames" must still be in tablename.fieldname format. 
7232          For Expression objects in "fields", the associated "colnames" can 
7233          be any arbitrary labels. 
7234           
7235          Note, the DAL Table objects referred to by "fields" or "colnames" can 
7236          be dummy tables and do not have to represent any real tables in the 
7237          database. Also, note that the "fields" and "colnames" must be in the 
7238          same order as the fields in the results cursor returned from the DB. 
7239          """ 
7240          adapter = self._adapter 
7241          if placeholders: 
7242              adapter.execute(query, placeholders) 
7243          else: 
7244              adapter.execute(query) 
7245          if as_dict: 
7246              if not hasattr(adapter.cursor,'description'): 
7247                  raise RuntimeError, "database does not support executesql(...,as_dict=True)" 
7248              # Non-DAL legacy db query, converts cursor results to dict. 
7249              # sequence of 7-item sequences. each sequence tells about a column. 
7250              # first item is always the field name according to Python Database API specs 
7251              columns = adapter.cursor.description 
7252              # reduce the column info down to just the field names 
7253              fields = [f[0] for f in columns] 
7254              # will hold our finished resultset in a list 
7255              data = adapter.cursor.fetchall() 
7256              # convert the list for each row into a dictionary so it's 
7257              # easier to work with. row['field_name'] rather than row[0] 
7258              return [dict(zip(fields,row)) for row in data] 
7259          try: 
7260              data = adapter.cursor.fetchall() 
7261          except: 
7262              return None 
7263          if fields or colnames: 
7264              fields = [] if fields is None else fields 
7265              if not isinstance(fields, list): 
7266                  fields = [fields] 
7267              extracted_fields = [] 
7268              for field in fields: 
7269                  if isinstance(field, Table): 
7270                      extracted_fields.extend([f for f in field]) 
7271                  else: 
7272                      extracted_fields.append(field) 
7273              if not colnames: 
7274                  colnames = ['%s.%s' % (f.tablename, f.name) 
7275                              for f in extracted_fields] 
7276              data = adapter.parse( 
7277                  data, fields=extracted_fields, colnames=colnames) 
7278          return data

7403   
7404          Each table will have automatically an 'id'. 
7405   
7406          If a field is of type Table, the fields (excluding 'id') from that table

7723 -    def _listify(self,fields,update=False): 

7724          new_fields = {} # format: new_fields[name] = (field,value) 
7725   
7726          # store all fields passed as input in new_fields 
7727          for name in fields: 
7728              if not name in self.fields: 
7729                  if name != 'id': 
7730                      raise SyntaxError, \ 
7731                          'Field %s does not belong to the table' % name 
7732              else: 
7733                  field = self[name] 
7734                  value = fields[name] 
7735                  if field.filter_in: 
7736                      value = field.filter_in(value) 
7737                  new_fields[name] = (field,value) 
7738   
7739          # check all fields that should be in the table but are not passed 
7740          to_compute = [] 
7741          for ofield in self: 
7742              name = ofield.name 
7743              if not name in new_fields: 
7744                  # if field is supposed to be computed, compute it! 
7745                  if ofield.compute: # save those to compute for later 
7746                      to_compute.append((name,ofield)) 
7747                  # if field is required, check its default value 
7748                  elif not update and not ofield.default is None: 
7749                      value = ofield.default 
7750                      fields[name] = value 
7751                      new_fields[name] = (ofield,value) 
7752                  # if this is an update, user the update field instead 
7753                  elif update and not ofield.update is None: 
7754                      value = ofield.update 
7755                      fields[name] = value 
7756                      new_fields[name] = (ofield,value) 
7757                  # if the field is still not there but it should, error 
7758                  elif not update and ofield.required: 
7759                      raise RuntimeError, \ 
7760                          'Table: missing required field: %s' % name 
7761          # now deal with fields that are supposed to be computed 
7762          if to_compute: 
7763              row = Row(fields) 
7764              for name,ofield in to_compute: 
7765                  # try compute it 
7766                  try: 
7767                      new_fields[name] = (ofield,ofield.compute(row)) 
7768                  except (KeyError, AttributeError): 
7769                      # error sinlently unless field is required! 
7770                      if ofield.required: 
7771                          raise SyntaxError, 'unable to comput field: %s' % name 
7772          return new_fields.values() 

7773   

7774 -    def _attempt_upload(self, fields): 

7775          for field in self: 
7776              if field.type=='upload' and field.name in fields: 
7777                  value = fields[field.name] 
7778                  if value and not isinstance(value,str): 
7779                      if hasattr(value,'file') and hasattr(value,'filename'): 
7780                          new_name = field.store(value.file,filename=value.filename) 
7781                      elif hasattr(value,'read') and hasattr(value,'name'): 
7782                          new_name = field.store(value,filename=value.name) 
7783                      else: 
7784                          raise RuntimeError, "Unable to handle upload" 
7785                      fields[field.name] = new_name 

7786

7795              fields = Row(fields) 
7796              [f(fields,ret) for f in self._after_insert] 
7797          return ret

7799 -    def validate_and_insert(self,**fields):

7805              if error: 
7806                  response.errors[key] = error 
7807              else: 
7808                  new_fields[key] = value 
7809          if not response.errors: 
7810              response.id = self.insert(**new_fields)

7813          return response

7829 -    def bulk_insert(self, items):

7831          here items is a list of dictionaries
