7845 -    def import_from_csv_file( 
7846          self, 
7847          csvfile, 
7848          id_map=None, 
7849          null='<NULL>', 
7850          unique='uuid', 
7851          id_offset=None, # id_offset used only when id_map is None 
7852          *args, **kwargs 
7853          ): 

7854          """ 
7855          Import records from csv file. 
7856          Column headers must have same names as table fields. 
7857          Field 'id' is ignored. 
7858          If column names read 'table.file' the 'table.' prefix is ignored. 
7859          'unique' argument is a field which must be unique 
7860              (typically a uuid field) 
7861          'restore' argument is default False; 
7862              if set True will remove old values in table first. 
7863          'id_map' ff set to None will not map ids. 
7864          The import will keep the id numbers in the restored table. 
7865          This assumes that there is an field of type id that 
7866          is integer and in incrementing order. 
7867          Will keep the id numbers in restored table. 
7868          """ 
7869   
7870          delimiter = kwargs.get('delimiter', ',') 
7871          quotechar = kwargs.get('quotechar', '"') 
7872          quoting = kwargs.get('quoting', csv.QUOTE_MINIMAL) 
7873          restore = kwargs.get('restore', False) 
7874          if restore: 
7875              self._db[self].truncate() 
7876   
7877          reader = csv.reader(csvfile, delimiter=delimiter, 
7878                              quotechar=quotechar, quoting=quoting) 
7879          colnames = None 
7880          if isinstance(id_map, dict): 
7881              if not self._tablename in id_map: 
7882                  id_map[self._tablename] = {} 
7883              id_map_self = id_map[self._tablename] 
7884   
7885          def fix(field, value, id_map, id_offset): 
7886              list_reference_s='list:reference' 
7887              if value == null: 
7888                  value = None 
7889              elif field.type=='blob': 
7890                  value = base64.b64decode(value) 
7891              elif field.type=='double' or field.type=='float': 
7892                  if not value.strip(): 
7893                      value = None 
7894                  else: 
7895                      value = float(value) 
7896              elif field.type in ('integer','bigint'): 
7897                  if not value.strip(): 
7898                      value = None 
7899                  else: 
7900                      value = int(value) 
7901              elif field.type.startswith('list:string'): 
7902                  value = bar_decode_string(value) 
7903              elif field.type.startswith(list_reference_s): 
7904                  ref_table = field.type[len(list_reference_s):].strip() 
7905                  value = [id_map[ref_table][int(v)] \ 
7906                               for v in bar_decode_string(value)] 
7907              elif field.type.startswith('list:'): 
7908                  value = bar_decode_integer(value) 
7909              elif id_map and field.type.startswith('reference'): 
7910                  try: 
7911                      value = id_map[field.type[9:].strip()][int(value)] 
7912                  except KeyError: 
7913                      pass 
7914              elif id_offset and field.type.startswith('reference'): 
7915                  try: 
7916                      value = id_offset[field.type[9:].strip()]+int(value) 
7917                  except KeyError: 
7918                      pass 
7919              return (field.name, value) 

7920   
7921          def is_id(colname): 
7922              if colname in self: 
7923                  return self[colname].type == 'id' 
7924              else: 
7925                  return False 

7926   
7927          first = True 
7928          unique_idx = None 
7929          for line in reader: 
7930              if not line: 
7931                  break 
7932              if not colnames: 
7933                  colnames = [x.split('.',1)[-1] for x in line][:len(line)] 
7934                  cols, cid = [], None 
7935                  for i,colname in enumerate(colnames): 
7936                      if is_id(colname): 
7937                          cid = i 
7938                      else: 
7939                          cols.append(i) 
7940                      if colname == unique: 
7941                          unique_idx = i 
7942              else: 
7943                  items = [fix(self[colnames[i]], line[i], id_map, id_offset) \ 
7944                               for i in cols if colnames[i] in self.fields] 
7945   
7946                  if not id_map and cid is not None and id_offset is not None and not unique_idx: 
7947                      csv_id = int(line[cid]) 
7948                      curr_id = self.insert(**dict(items)) 
7949                      if first: 
7950                          first = False 
7951                          # First curr_id is bigger than csv_id, 
7952                          # then we are not restoring but 
7953                          # extending db table with csv db table 
7954                          if curr_id>csv_id: 
7955                              id_offset[self._tablename] = curr_id-csv_id 
7956                          else: 
7957                              id_offset[self._tablename] = 0 
7958                      # create new id until we get the same as old_id+offset 
7959                      while curr_id<csv_id+id_offset[self._tablename]: 
7960                          self._db(self._db[self][colnames[cid]] == curr_id).delete() 
7961                          curr_id = self.insert(**dict(items)) 
7962                  # Validation. Check for duplicate of 'unique' &, 
7963                  # if present, update instead of insert. 
7964                  elif not unique_idx: 
7965                      new_id = self.insert(**dict(items)) 
7966                  else: 
7967                      unique_value = line[unique_idx] 
7968                      query = self._db[self][unique] == unique_value 
7969                      record = self._db(query).select().first() 
7970                      if record: 
7971                          record.update_record(**dict(items)) 
7972                          new_id = record[self._id.name] 
7973                      else: 
7974                          new_id = self.insert(**dict(items)) 
7975                  if id_map and cid is not None: 
7976                      id_map_self[int(line[cid])] = new_id 
7977   

7978 -    def with_alias(self, alias): 

7979          return self._db._adapter.alias(self,alias) 

7980   

7981 -    def on(self, query): 

7982          return Expression(self._db,self._db._adapter.ON,self,query) 

7983   

7984 -def archive_record(qset,fs,archive_table,current_record): 

7985      tablenames = qset.db._adapter.tables(qset.query) 
7986      if len(tablenames)!=1: raise RuntimeError, "cannot update join" 
7987      table = qset.db[tablenames[0]] 
7988      for row in qset.select(): 
7989          fields = archive_table._filter_fields(row) 
7990          fields[current_record] = row.id 
7991          archive_table.insert(**fields) 
7992      return False

8264 -class SQLCustomType(object): 

8265      """ 
8266      allows defining of custom SQL types 
8267   
8268      Example:: 
8269   
8270          decimal = SQLCustomType( 
8271              type ='double', 
8272              native ='integer', 
8273              encoder =(lambda x: int(float(x) * 100)), 
8274              decoder = (lambda x: Decimal("0.00") + Decimal(str(float(x)/100)) ) 
8275              ) 
8276   
8277          db.define_table( 
8278              'example', 
8279              Field('value', type=decimal) 
8280              ) 
8281   
8282      :param type: the web2py type (default = 'string') 
8283      :param native: the backend type 
8284      :param encoder: how to encode the value to store it in the backend 
8285      :param decoder: how to decode the value retrieved from the backend 
8286      :param validator: what validators to use ( default = None, will use the 
8287          default validator for type) 
8288      """

8301          self.native = native 
8302          self.encoder = encoder or (lambda x: x) 
8303          self.decoder = decoder or (lambda x: x) 
8304          self.validator = validator 
8305          self._class = _class or type

8335 -class Field(Expression):

8340      """ 
8341      an instance of this class represents a database field 
8342   
8343      example:: 
8344   
8345          a = Field(name, 'string', length=32, default=None, required=False, 
8346              requires=IS_NOT_EMPTY(), ondelete='CASCADE', 
8347              notnull=False, unique=False, 
8348              uploadfield=True, widget=None, label=None, comment=None, 
8349              uploadfield=True, # True means store on disk, 
8350                                # 'a_field_name' means store in this field in db 
8351                                # False means file content will be discarded. 
8352              writable=True, readable=True, update=None, authorize=None, 
8353              autodelete=False, represent=None, uploadfolder=None, 
8354              uploadseparate=False # upload to separate directories by uuid_keys 
8355                                   # first 2 character and tablename.fieldname 
8356                                   # False - old behavior 
8357                                   # True - put uploaded file in 
8358                                   #   <uploaddir>/<tablename>.<fieldname>/uuid_key[:2] 
8359                                   #        directory) 
8360              uploadfs=None     # a pyfilesystem where to store upload 
8361   
8362      to be used as argument of DAL.define_table 
8363   
8364      allowed field types: 
8365      string, boolean, integer, double, text, blob, 
8366      date, time, datetime, upload, password 
8367   
8368      strings must have a length of Adapter.maxcharlength by default (512 or 255 for mysql) 
8369      fields should have a default or they will be required in SQLFORMs 
8370      the requires argument is used to validate the field input in SQLFORMs 
8371   
8372      """

8458 -    def store(self, file, filename=None, path=None): 

8459          if self.custom_store: 
8460              return self.custom_store(file,filename,path)

8462              file = file.file 
8463              filename = filename or file.filename 
8464          elif not filename: 
8465              filename = file.name 
8466          filename = os.path.basename(filename.replace('/', os.sep)\ 
8467                                          .replace('\\', os.sep))         
8468          m = REGEX_STORE_PATTERN.search(filename) 
8469          extension = m and m.group('e') or 'txt' 
8470          uuid_key = web2py_uuid().replace('-', '')[-16:]

8473              (self._tablename, self.name, uuid_key, encoded_filename)

8489                  raise RuntimeError,\ 
8490                      "you must specify a Field(...,uploadfolder=...)" 
8491              if self.uploadseparate: 
8492                  if self.uploadfs: 
8493                      raise RuntimeError, "not supported"

8495                                      uuid_key[:2]) 
8496              if not exists(path): 
8497                  os.makedirs(path) 
8498              pathfilename = pjoin(path, newfilename) 
8499              if self.uploadfs: 
8500                  dest_file = self.uploadfs.open(newfilename, 'wb') 
8501              else: 
8502                  dest_file = open(pathfilename, 'wb')

8504                  shutil.copyfileobj(file, dest_file) 
8505              except IOError:

8674 -class Set(object): 

8675   
8676      """ 
8677      a Set represents a set of records in the database, 
8678      the records are identified by the query=Query(...) object. 
8679      normally the Set is generated by DAL.__call__(Query(...)) 
8680   
8681      given a set, for example 
8682         set = db(db.users.name=='Max') 
8683      you can: 
8684         set.update(db.users.name='Massimo') 
8685         set.delete() # all elements in the set 
8686         set.select(orderby=db.users.id, groupby=db.users.name, limitby=(0,10)) 
8687      and take subsets: 
8688         subset = set(db.users.id<5) 
8689      """

9023 -    def find(self,f,limitby=None): 

9024          """ 
9025          returns a new Rows object, a subset of the original object, 
9026          filtered by the function f 
9027          """ 
9028          if not self: 
9029              return Rows(self.db, [], self.colnames) 
9030          records = [] 
9031          if limitby: 
9032              a,b = limitby 
9033          else: 
9034              a,b = 0,len(self) 
9035          k = 0 
9036          for row in self: 
9037              if f(row): 
9038                  if a<=k: records.append(row) 
9039                  k += 1 
9040                  if k==b: break 
9041          return Rows(self.db, records, self.colnames)

9043 -    def exclude(self, f): 

9044          """ 
9045          removes elements from the calling Rows object, filtered by the function f, 
9046          and returns a new Rows object containing the removed elements 
9047          """ 
9048          if not self.records: 
9049              return Rows(self.db, [], self.colnames) 
9050          removed = [] 
9051          i=0 
9052          while i<len(self): 
9053              row = self[i] 
9054              if f(row): 
9055                  removed.append(self.records[i]) 
9056                  del self.records[i] 
9057              else: 
9058                  i += 1 
9059          return Rows(self.db, removed, self.colnames)

9066          rows.records = sorted(self,key=f,reverse=reverse)

9070 -    def group_by_value(self, field): 

9071          """ 
9072          regroups the rows, by one of the fields 
9073          """

9075              return {} 
9076          key = str(field) 
9077          grouped_row_group = dict() 
9078

9080              value = row[key] 
9081              if not value in grouped_row_group: 
9082                  grouped_row_group[value] = [row] 
9083              else: 
9084                  grouped_row_group[value].append(row)

9096          """

9102          self.compact = compact

9113          returns the data as a dictionary of dictionaries (storage_to_dict=True) or records (False) 
9114   
9115          :param key: the name of the field to be used as dict key, normally the id 
9116          :param compact: ? (default True) 
9117          :param storage_to_dict: when True returns a dict, otherwise a list(default True) 
9118          :param datetime_to_str: convert datetime fields as strings (default True) 
9119          """ 
9120          rows = self.as_list(compact, storage_to_dict, datetime_to_str, custom_types) 
9121          if isinstance(key,str) and key.count('.')==1: 
9122              (table, field) = key.split('.') 
9123              return dict([(r[table][field],r) for r in rows]) 
9124          elif isinstance(key,str): 
9125              return dict([(r[key],r) for r in rows]) 
9126          else: 
9127              return dict([(key(r),r) for r in rows]) 

9128   

9129 -    def export_to_csv_file(self, ofile, null='<NULL>', *args, **kwargs): 

9130          """ 
9131          export data to csv, the first line contains the column names 
9132   
9133          :param ofile: where the csv must be exported to 
9134          :param null: how null values must be represented (default '<NULL>') 
9135          :param delimiter: delimiter to separate values (default ',') 
9136          :param quotechar: character to use to quote string values (default '"') 
9137          :param quoting: quote system, use csv.QUOTE_*** (default csv.QUOTE_MINIMAL) 
9138          :param represent: use the fields .represent value (default False) 
9139          :param colnames: list of column names to use (default self.colnames) 
9140                           This will only work when exporting rows objects!!!! 
9141                           DO NOT use this with db.export_to_csv() 
9142          """ 
9143          delimiter = kwargs.get('delimiter', ',') 
9144          quotechar = kwargs.get('quotechar', '"') 
9145          quoting = kwargs.get('quoting', csv.QUOTE_MINIMAL) 
9146          represent = kwargs.get('represent', False) 
9147          writer = csv.writer(ofile, delimiter=delimiter, 
9148                              quotechar=quotechar, quoting=quoting) 
9149          colnames = kwargs.get('colnames', self.colnames) 
9150          write_colnames = kwargs.get('write_colnames',True) 
9151          # a proper csv starting with the column names 
9152          if write_colnames: 
9153              writer.writerow(colnames) 
9154   
9155          def none_exception(value): 
9156              """ 
9157              returns a cleaned up value that can be used for csv export: 
9158              - unicode text is encoded as such 
9159              - None values are replaced with the given representation (default <NULL>) 
9160              """ 
9161              if value is None: 
9162                  return null 
9163              elif isinstance(value, unicode): 
9164                  return value.encode('utf8') 
9165              elif isinstance(value,Reference): 
9166                  return int(value) 
9167              elif hasattr(value, 'isoformat'): 
9168                  return value.isoformat()[:19].replace('T', ' ') 
9169              elif isinstance(value, (list,tuple)): # for type='list:..' 
9170                  return bar_encode(value) 
9171              return value 

9172   
9173          for record in self: 
9174              row = [] 
9175              for col in colnames: 
9176                  if not REGEX_TABLE_DOT_FIELD.match(col): 
9177                      row.append(record._extra[col]) 
9178                  else: 
9179                      (t, f) = col.split('.') 
9180                      field = self.db[t][f] 
9181                      if isinstance(record.get(t, None), (Row,dict)): 
9182                          value = record[t][f] 
9183                      else: 
9184                          value = record[f] 
9185                      if field.type=='blob' and not value is None: 
9186                          value = base64.b64encode(value) 
9187                      elif represent and field.represent: 
9188                          value = field.represent(value) 
9189                      row.append(none_exception(value)) 
9190              writer.writerow(row) 

9191   

9192 -    def xml(self,strict=False,row_name='row',rows_name='rows'): 

9193          """ 
9194          serializes the table using sqlhtml.SQLTABLE (if present) 
9195          """         
9196          if strict: 
9197              ncols = len(self.colnames) 
9198              def f(row,field,indent='  '): 
9199                  if isinstance(row,Row): 
9200                      spc = indent+'  \n' 
9201                      items = [f(row[x],x,indent+'  ') for x in row] 
9202                      return '%s<%s>\n%s\n%s</%s>' % ( 
9203                          indent, 
9204                          field, 
9205                          spc.join(item for item in items if item), 
9206                          indent, 
9207                          field) 
9208                  elif not callable(row): 
9209                      if REGEX_ALPHANUMERIC.match(field): 
9210                          return '%s<%s>%s</%s>' % (indent,field,row,field) 
9211                      else: 
9212                          return '%s<extra name="%s">%s</extra>' % \ 
9213                              (indent,field,row) 
9214                  else: 
9215                      return None 

9216              return '<%s>\n%s\n</%s>' % ( 
9217                  rows_name, 
9218                  '\n'.join(f(row,row_name) for row in self), 
9219                  rows_name) 
9220          import sqlhtml 
9221          return sqlhtml.SQLTABLE(self).xml() 
9222   

9223 -    def json(self, mode='object', default=None): 

9224          """ 
9225          serializes the table to a JSON list of objects 
9226          """ 
9227          mode = mode.lower() 
9228          if not mode in ['object', 'array']: 
9229              raise SyntaxError, 'Invalid JSON serialization mode: %s' % mode 
9230   
9231          def inner_loop(record, col): 
9232              (t, f) = col.split('.') 
9233              res = None 
9234              if not REGEX_TABLE_DOT_FIELD.match(col): 
9235                  key = col 
9236                  res = record._extra[col] 
9237              else: 
9238                  key = f 
9239                  if isinstance(record.get(t, None), Row): 
9240                      res = record[t][f] 
9241                  else: 
9242                      res = record[f] 
9243              if mode == 'object': 
9244                  return (key, res) 
9245              else: 
9246                  return res 

9247   
9248          if mode == 'object': 
9249              items = [dict([inner_loop(record, col) for col in 
9250                       self.colnames]) for record in self] 
9251          else: 
9252              items = [[inner_loop(record, col) for col in self.colnames] 
9253                       for record in self] 
9254          if have_serializers: 
9255              return serializers.json(items,default=default or serializers.custom_json) 
9256          else: 
9257              import simplejson 
9258              return simplejson.dumps(items)

9296                         uploadf=None, integerf=5, doublef=3.14,\ 
9297                         datef=datetime.date(2001, 1, 1),\ 
9298                         timef=datetime.time(12, 30, 15),\ 
9299                         datetimef=datetime.datetime(2002, 2, 2, 12, 30, 15)) 
9300      1

9303

9309                Field('name'),\ 
9310                Field('birth','date'),\

9333      1

9346      1

9446      QCD
